Now for the further growth of their business, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase auto repair materials for her husband's shop. As their family expenditures are higher than their monthly income and savings, Parveen wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount, as a result of which they can increase their monthly income as well as savings. 

Parveen dreams of providing higher education to her children. And she is very much thankful to Kiva for such great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase auto repair materials for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Baasankhuu, who is 24 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple lives far away from city center and there he breeds cattle and pigs. His income comes from dairy products and handmade block sales. His wife has full time job. 

Baasankhuu is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. He needs a car to transport fodder and other block manufacturing materials between his home and the city.

Baasankhuu is very hardworking individual who strives for better future. In the photo, you can see his necessary electric car, a Prius.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин житель столицы Таджикистана. Ему 39 лет. Он женат и имеет 13-летнюю дочь и 12-летнего сына, которые учатся в средней школе. У Фахриддина среднее специальное образование. Он уже более 4-х лет вместе с женой занимается производством и продажей шаурмы. Фахриддин работает в столовой, которая расположена на рынке города. Он готовит и продает там шаурму, самбусу (пирожок с мясной начинкой), компот и мороженное. Он получает хороший доход, что позволяет ему и обеспечивать семью и продвигать бизнес. Так как количество его клиентов увеличивается день за днем, ему необходимо расширить свой бизнес. Для этого он нуждается в кредите. Фахриддин просит кредит для закупа оборудования гриля для производства шаурмы и большой духовки для выпекания самбусы. Он нуждается в Вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Fakhriddin is a resident of the capital of Tajikistan. He is 39 years old. He is married and has a 13-year-old daughter and 12-year-old son, who go to high school. Fakhriddin has a specialized high school education. For more than four years, he and his wife have been engaged in producing and selling shawarma. Fakhriddin works in a dining hall, which is located in the city market. There he prepares and sells shawarma, sambusu (meat pie), compote, and ice cream. 

He get a good income that allows him to support his family and to promote the business. Since the number of his customers increases day by day, he needs to expand his business. For this, he needs a loan. Fakhriddin is asking for a loan to buy grilling equipment for producing shawarma and a large oven to bake sambusu.

loans.use: to purchase grilling equipment and a large oven to expand the business

loans.name: Mujeres Hacendozas Group

texts.es:
Este comité llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 12  del programa de comité de mujeres, cuenta con 15  integrantes actualmente, todas ellas cuentan con actividades comerciales actualmente,es un grupo muy solidario,participan en las capacitaciones y tienen un excelente comportamiento de pago. De las 15 mujeres 7 se encuentran en el Programa de Eliminación de Pobreza, luchando para salir del nivel en el que se encuentran e ir mejorando día con día por sus hijos.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora Celsa  de 67  años, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, tiene una clientela formada y esta actividad le sirve para sostener a su familia económicamente. Ella es una persona mayor, que sigue trabajando y comenta que siempre ha trabajado y que le gusta mucho poder sentirse útil.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para compra de insumos que necesita para seguir haciendo sus comestibles, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, adheresos y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group named Mujeres Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] is in its 12th cycle of the women's committee program. It currently has 15 members, all of whom have businesses at the moment. It is a group with a lot of solidarity; they participate in trainings and have an excellent payment record. Of the 15 women, 7 are in the Elimination of Poverty program, striving to escape from the level of poverty they are experiencing and improving life for their children day by day.

One of the stories worth highlighting is that of 67-year-old Celsa, who makes a living from selling groceries. She has an established clientele and her business serves to sustain her family financially. She is an older person who keeps working; she says that she has always worked and that she really likes feeling useful.

Celsa is asking for this loan to buy supplies that she needs to keep selling her groceries, like meat, condiments, vegetables, seasonings and other items. This will help her to consolidate her business plan, which helps her in turn to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, seasonings and other items.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz de 50 años, esta casada con Carlos, con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero ahora solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Luz se dedica a la agricultura y posee varios terrenos dentro de su localidad, en donde cultiva café orgánico. Pero como es una mujer muy trabajadora, también tiene una tienda donde vende productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros, además de instalar un teléfono público, siendo el único de la zona, por esa razón tiene buenos ingresos y muy buenos clientes. Ahora desea abastecer su tienda ya que sufrió un pequeño robo. Es el segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Luz destinará el dinero en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, harina, leche, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Luz, 50, is married to Carlos with whom she has six children but only one of them still lives with them in their own house.  Luz works in agriculture and has several parcels of land in her location where she grows organic coffee.  But since she’s a very hardworking working woman she also has a grocery store where she sells food items like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  She’s also installed a public telephone which is the only one in the zone so it produces good income and a good clientele.

She wants to stock her store now because she suffered a small robbery.  This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’ll get to continue forward and she also commits to make her payments punctually.  Luz will use the money to buy food items like rice, flour, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old, married and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him by growing vegetables in her garden for sale. She has been doing this for more than 20 years to earn a living. 

She took a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to grow another variety of vegetables in order to generate more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh was born in 1994. He lives in Bac Ninh – the smallest province in Vietnam. He studies electronics and telecommunications at the Hanoi University of Industry. His course lasts 38 months and he will graduate in 2015. His family has eight members. He is the first person in his family who graduated from high school and studies in college. His parents grows rice to earn a living. Besides that, his mother goes to a market to sell dry food. His family’s income is about 12,000,000 VND per month. His education fees are subsidized by his parents. Anh plans to find a part-time job to earn more money to pay his education fees. He understands that learning helps him to have opportunities to get a high-paying job. He is aware that this major is suitable for himself and very important in the present society. These are the reasons why he has chosen this major. After graduating, he can earn more money to afford his family, and improve his family’s living standard. He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay his education fees, books, and studying tools. If he cannot gain access to this loan, his studies will be interrupted. He wants to send a sincere thanks to lenders across the world. This program has supported his  education individually, and the Vietnamese younger generations in general.

loans.use: to pay his education fees, books, and studying tools.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena operates a sari-sari (variety) store for a living in the community of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a 49-year-old widow and has three children. She has been doing business since her husband died. Without hesitation, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy canned goods, noodles, and sugar for sale. She hopes she will be able to support the needs of her children and provide them a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma. She previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norma hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family will always be in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business like siopao, cup cake, chips etc. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business like siopao, cup cake, chips etc.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a hard-working woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, son and two daughters. All of her children are studying in school.  Her husband has owned a workshop, which is the only source of income for their family. His income is insufficient to meet the household needs. That is why for the further growth of their business Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase auto repair material for husband's shop. 

Their family expenditures are too high as compared to the monthly income and savings. Therefore, he wants to open a new shop for her son, with the profit  from the loan amount. Thus, they can increase their monthly income as well as savings. She dreams of higher education for her children. And she is very much thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase auto repair material for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet lives in the village Goght which is in Kotayk region. Karapet has large family; he lives with his retired parents, wife, son, daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren. Karapet and his wife are engaged in farming and agriculture. Their son also sometimes helps them in that occupation. Karapet has a plot of rented land on which he cultivates tomato, cucumber, and greens, and he also raises apple and apricot trees. In his farm, he breeds two cows, one heifer, two bulls, five beehives and sixty chickens. Both his farm and agricultural products Krapet sells through the reseller right from his house. Karapet’s family is very large and financial problems are numerous that is why Karapet works day and night in order to provide his family and to take care of his farm as well.

Karapet needs this loan in order to build fences around his garden, where he has a lot of apple and apricot trees.

loans.use: to build fences around his garden, where he has a lot of apple and apricot trees

loans.name: Helen Eloisa

texts.es: Helen, tiene 38 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo y vive con su hijo y su abuela en un Barrio de San Pedro Sula.  Helen tenia una pulpería anteriormente, pero hace 7 meses decidió establecer un negocio de comidas rápidas como pollo frito con tajadas, pupusas, baleadas, tacos etc. Este negocio también lo tiene en su casa. Con el préstamo de 10,000 lempiras que a solicitado va comprar pollo, papas, harina, aceite, bananos verdes, condimentos etc.para la elaboracion de comidas Con el objetivo de aumentar sus ventas. Su meta es abrir un nuevo negocio y lograr que su hijo se gradúe de la universidad.
texts.en: Helen, 38, is a single mother; she has a son and lives with her son and her grandmother in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Helen used to have a grocery store but 7 months ago decided to start selling fast-food like fried chicken with fried plantain slices, ‘pupusas’ [filled grilled corn cakes], ‘baleadas’ [filled flour tortillas], tacos, etc.  This business is also home-based.  She will use the 10,000 Lempira loan she’s requested to buy chicken, potatoes, flour, oil, green plantain, condiments, etc. to make the food with the objective of increasing her sales.  Her goal is to open a new business and that her son graduates from university.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes, flour, oil, green plantain, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Malengo Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her late 30s, is married and has two kids, who are in school. Christina has had a business selling fruits and vegetables (genge) for three years. She is doing fine in this project, which permits Christina to meet her family’s basic daily needs. She starts working a 5am and works to 6pm daily and is capable of earning a fair income each month. 
This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans all, which she repaid successfully, she restocked her business with items like tomatoes, onions, vegetables and varieties of fruits. With the returns received from business, she paid school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the items that are missing in her business. Christina dreams of being able to buy a plot of land for house-building. 
She will share this loan with her "Malengo" loan group, which consists of 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the items that she needs for her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Wakazi Group

texts.en:
John, who in in his late 30s, is married and has three children, who are still going to school.  For the past six years, John has been running a business of telephone money transfers (M-pesa, Tigo-pesa, Airtel Money). He works from 7:00AM to 10:00PM daily. Doing this, he is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use his share of the group loan to increase the telephone fund transfer capacity of his business, so as to meet more customer demand. He dreams that one day he will be able to grow his business greatly. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Wakazi, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the telephone fund transfer capacity of his business, so as to meet more customer demand

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Solomoni, who is in his mid 40s, is single with a boy who is in college now. 

He has been managing his life by running two different types of businesses, a cafeteria where he sells things like chips, juice, sodas and water, and a dry cleaning business. He has had the dry cleaning business since 2008 and has had the cafeteria for one year.  In the cafeteria business, he has employed a helper. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to make a small profit per month.

This will be his fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Solomoni used the previous loans to open the cafeteria business so as to grow his profits. With the profit from his businesses, he managed to cover household expenses and tuition fees for his boy, and to reinvest in the business. 

He is trying to look for a way to improve his dry cleaning business so as to serve more people as well as earn more profit. He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy a dry-cleaner machine and a fridge for the cafeteria. He dreams of seeing his businesses grow.

Solomoni will share this loan with his loan group "Mungu Tubariki," which consists of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dry-cleaner machine and a fridge for the cafeteria.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: hire laborers to quarry stonres

loans.name: Loveness Kivule Group

texts.en:
Mathias is in his early 40s and is married with four children, two boys and two girls. He runs a retail shop where he sales fresh milk. He has been in this service for six months now and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Mathias' 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock missing items in his shop inventory, such as sugar, beans, baking flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil. These are the items that move fast and are always getting out of stock. He started selling fresh milk for customers to drink from his shop and for taking away. He sells hot and cold drinks as well as yoghurt. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit from his last loans to pay for his children's school fees and household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more milk to resell. He dreams of his giving his children a good education.

Mathias will share this loan with his loan group, Loveness Kivule, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more milk to resell.

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.en:
Ismail, who in his late twenties, is married and has two children -- a boy and a girl.  He has been running a telephone accessories business for four years now.  He works from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Ismail's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the out of stock items and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more telephone accessories for making more sales.  He dreams of expanding his business by opening another shop to sell the same types of items.

Ismail will share this loan with his loan group "KILIMANJARO" with eleven members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy telephone accessories to sell

loans.name: Anogile Group

texts.en:
Swada earns an income by offering a variety of fruits and vegetables for sale, including tomatoes and onions. He works daily from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. and is able to earn a small business return. Swada used to be a mining laborer, and he started his present business to get out of that kind of activity, which he found difficult to sustain. He is in his mid-thirties. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he will use his loan funds to replenish his inventory of fruits and vegetables. He dreams that one day he will be able to expand his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group, which is called Anogile and which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 53-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 30-year-old son. 

Eunice engages in buy and sell business. She buys at the same time sells bananas and coconuts.She has been into buy and sell for almost 6 years now.

Eunice requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more supply for her buy and sell business like coconut, banana and cassava, this will help Eunice generate more income and to sustain her livelihood activity. In the future, Eunice would like to expand her buy and sell business to improve their livelihood s.

loans.use: to buy  more supply  for her buy-and-sell business like coconut, banana and cassava

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 64 years old and comes from Talibon, Bohol. She is a widow and has two grown children. To support herself, she has been raising hogs for 15 years.
 
She  is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP. She will use it to support her business and buy feed. With the availability of this feed, she will be able to focus on caring for her hogs, and feeding them so that they will grow healthy and be easier to market in four months. Lucresia is grateful that, in spite of her age, she can still work hard to support her needs. In the future, she hopes to expand her business

loans.use: to support her business and buy feed

loans.name: Jose Ellery

texts.en:
Jose Ellery is a 54-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has  five children. His work is fishing. He catches fish and crabs and sells them to the community.  He has been in fishing for almost 12 years.  

Jose Ellery requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy  fishing materials like fishing net. In the future, Jose Ellery would like to expand his fishing  business to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials  like fishing net

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis sells fruits and vegetables to earn an income. In the evenings, after she closes her fruit and vegetable stand, she prepares and sells snacks such as samosas and bagia bites (smaller versions of traditional Tanzanian fried chickpea buns). She is in her mid-forties. She and her husband have five school-going children.

This will be Mwanahamis's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to replenish out-of-stock items in her fruits and vegetables business. She also used her loan funds to start selling her samosas and bagia bites, allowing her to increase her profit. She used her profits to help her husband to support the household and pay for their children's school fees. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans.   

She will use her present loan to buy more tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and mangoes, which are currently out of stock in her business, and to buy more ingredients for making samosas and bagia bites. 

Mwanahamis dreams of living a good life with her family.

She will share this loan with her loan group, which is called Tupendane C. It has 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to vegetables and fruits to offer for sale as well as to buy ingredients for making samosas and bagia bites

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old and a single mother of two children. She grows vegetables in her garden and sells them in the market. She also cook some snacks for sale just to earn a living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy goods like vegetables and raw ingredients. She hopes to gain more income and save a portion of it for the better future of her children.

loans.use: to buy goods like vegetables and raw ingredients.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is from Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him with her buying and selling business.

Edna owns and operates a nipa-making business (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials). She has been in her business for more than seven years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC. Edna is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more nipa for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa for sale

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is married and has three children. Nelson is 54 years old and lives in Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Nelson owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Nelson has been engaged in his business for more than 13 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Nelson joined GDMPC. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy new tire and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and accessories.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
This is Mercedez's 20th loan cycle. She uses her loan as an additional capital for her business. Her income from her loan was a big help not just in her business but also in the education of her children and in their household expenses. Aside from her tricycle, she also has a van for rent and an apartment. She and her husband continue to work for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs as well as in her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedez dreams of continuously expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Murodboi

texts.ru:
Муродбой  добрый и трудолюбивый мужчина.  Он женат и имеет троих  чудесных детей. Его вид деятельности заключается в том что он печет лепешки в национальной печи(тандыр). Муродбой пекарь. Этому делу он научился от своего отца. Вот уже пять лет он печет вкусные и красивые лепешки.  Жена Муродбоя домохозяйка но тоже помогает своему мужу.  Она с самого утра месит тесто и помогает мужу в выпечке. У них это получается очень хорошо. 
У Муродбоя очень много клиентов, все вокруг покупают только его лепешки. Он даже печет необычные по виду лепешки на заказ. Это единственный доход в семье и это семья старается угождать клиентам и расширять свой бизнес.  
Муродбой в будущем планирует создать свою собственную пекарню и для этого он уже много лет копит денежные средства. Пока ему не хватает,поэтому на данный момент он хочет закупить муки и необходимые продукты для выпечки чтобы в будущем накопив денег осуществить свою мечту. С этой целю Муродбой обратился в Арванд за кредитом и на полученный кредит хочет закупить несколько мешков муки. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за понимание и поддержку в реализации своих планов.
texts.en:
Murodboi is a good and hardworking man. He is married and has three wonderful children. His activities include the baking of cakes in national ovens (tandoori). Murodboi is a baker. He learned this trade from his father. For five years already, he has been baking delicious and beautiful flatbreads. Murodboi's wife is a homemaker but also help her husband. She kneads the dough in the morning and helps her husband with the baking. They do this work very well.

Murodboi has many customers; everyone around buys only his flatbreads. He even bakes cakes to order that are unusual in appearance. This is the only income for the family and this family is trying to please customers and to expand their business.  

In the future, Murodboi plans to create his own bakery, and for this he has been saving up for many years. It is not enough so at the moment he wants to buy flour and needed baking products in order in the future to save money to fulfill his dream. With this goal, Murodboi turned to Arvand for a loan и на полученный кредит хочет закупить несколько мешков муки. He thanks Arvand in advance for their attention and support in realizing his plans.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Zulma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zulma tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella conoce de la agricultura desde muy pequeña, sus padres fueron agricultores, ya que en la zona donde vive es ampliamente utilizada para la siembra de maíz. Pasados los años, se caso con un miembro de la misma comunidad donde ella vive, un señor dedicado al trabajo de la siembra de maíz y es así como hoy en día ella también se a unido a trabajar con su esposo, y actualmente siembran 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. En los tiempos libres se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Ella vive en una zona donde no circula mucho transporte, viaja desde su casa en un carro que cada dos horas pasa por su casa, de ahí se dirige hasta el desvió de la ciudad, de donde sube a un autobús hasta otra ciudad, y compra los materiales para luego tomar el autobús y hacer el mismo recorrido hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas, para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con los ingresos que le genere la cosecha podrá cancelar el préstamo y a la vez le quedara ingresos para comprar el  alimento para su familia.

Su propósito, es seguir aumentando el número de metros cuadrados a sembrar, también quisiera poder mejorar su vivienda, y sobre todo poder estar al lado de sus hijos para crecerlos y educarlos con buenos principios, como a ella la educaron.
texts.en:
Zulma, 38, is married with three children. She’s known about agriculture since she was little because her parents were farmers because the zone she lives in is widely used for growing corn.  Years went by, she married someone from the same community where she lives, a man who also works growing corn, and this is how to this day she also has joined him to work together; they currently plant 21,000 square meters of corn.  In her free time she does her household chores.

She lives in a zone with very little transport service.  She travels from her house in a car that goes by her house every two hours.  From there she heads to the fork in the road that leads to the city and catches a bus to another city to buy the supplies to then take the bus and make the same trip back to her house.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy manure, pesticide and herbicide to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn.  With income generated from the harvest she’ll be able to repay the loan and have income left over to buy food for her family.

Her goal is to continue increasing the number of square meters planted and she’d also like to be able to do some home improvements and above all to be remain by her children to watch them grow and to instill good principles in them like she was educated.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling elei (Elei Fabric Printing is a fusion of the traditional decorative methods used to embellish cloth) in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to to buy materials, paint, screen print and brushes. In the future, Makerita hopes to save money for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paint, screen print and brushes

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
David, who is in his late 30s, is a married man with three children (a boy and two girls). His children are in school. David, a member of the Songa Mbele Group, has been managing a cafe and an Irish potatoes business. He is doing fine with his projects. He has been running his project since 2003, and he reports that it is profitable. He starts working at 10am and works to 12pm daily, and he has the ability of earning a good return every day.

 This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he repaid successfully, he managed to buy more café drinks, bought a fridge, repaired the business premises and started selling local chickens. With the profits received, he covered the home expenses and school fees and renovated his family’s house. He will use this loan to buy more bags of Irish potatoes to make  chips to sell. David dreams of being able to expand his business extensively, one day. 

He will share this loan with the other members of Songa Mbele Group, which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes to make chips to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia, a sus 58 años se dedica a cuidar de su familia, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo que ya es jubilado y tienen 3 hijos. Ella es una mujer juiciosa, entregada  a su familia y en especial a su hija menor que tiene síndrome de down, con la que han pasado situaciones muy difíciles en el transcurso de su vida.  
“Me gusta capacitarme en diversos temas, porque quiero tener diversas  opciones para montar mi propio negocio más adelante y poder apoyar la carga económica en mi hogar”, con estas palabras, Elvia manifiesta su motivación para solicitar el crédito, con el que pagará un curso de capacitación en Servicio de Mesa y Bar, porque quiere aprender a elaborar diferentes tipos de bebidas a base de café y cócteles, ya que ve en esto una oportunidad de negocio que puede ser rentable a mediano plazo. Su principal sueño es montar su propio negocio, con el que pueda obtener ingresos para continuar con el sostenimiento de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija con síndrome de down.
texts.en:
At the age of 58, Elvia works caring for her family; she’s a housewife living with her husband who is retired and they have three children.  She’s a prudent woman who is devoted to her family, especially her youngest daughter who has Down’s syndrome and with whom they’ve gone through difficult situations during the course of her lifetime.

“I like to get training in various topics because I want to have various options for starting my own business later on to help cover my home’s economic needs.”  With these words, Elvia states her motivation for requesting the loan that she’ll use to pay for a Table and Bar Service course because she wants to learn about various coffee-based beverages and cocktails since she sees a good business opportunity in this that could be profitable in the medium range.  Her main dream is to open her own business that will allow her to earn income to continue supporting her family and improving the quality of life of her daughter that has Down’s syndrome.

loans.use: to pay for a table and bar service course.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong was born in 1992. She lives in Bac Ninh - the smallest province in Vietnam. She is learning kindergarten teaching methods at Bac Ninh College of Pedagogy (www.cdspbacninh.edu.vn/‎). Her course lasts 36 months and she will graduate in 2014. Her education fees are subsidized by her parent. Huong plans to find a part-time job to pay for her education fees if she can not access this loan. However, that will affect her quality of studying. Huong’s family has four members. In the picture is Huong's mother. She always wants to send the bests to her daughter. Huong's parents grow rice to earn a living. Her family’s income is about 10,000,000 VND per month. Huong has a passion for her major. She loves to spend her ability in the Vietnamese pedagogical field. She understands that learning helps her bring knowledge to the next generations in the good way. She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for her education fees. Besides lacking tuition, she has other difficulties such as lacking money to buy a computer to support for her studying. She appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has been very supportive to the education of students in Vietnam.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
Rubielyn is 21 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for two years.

Rubielyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business. In the future, Rubielyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rita is 54 years old and has four children who are in school. Rita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Rita requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net and other tools for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Rita has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net and other tools for her business.

loans.name: Antonio Salvio

texts.es:
ANTONIO tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los padres los hijos viven con la madre en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

ANTONIO se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, maracuya, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para aplicar en la agricultura en la compra de fertilizantesm urea, abonos, líquido para convatir las plagas y balanceado para los cerdos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesarío para tratar la tierra y poder sembrar y engordar los animales.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las plagas en los cultivos el cogollero. El sueño es trabajar y superarce. En el tiempo libre le gusta dialogar con los padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 22 years old, is single, has two children and lives with his parents. His children live with their mother in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. A farmer, he is a member of the Bruniquilde Communal Bank located in the Calabi precinct, part of the Ventanas canton.

Antonio makes a living from agriculture, planting cacao and passion fruit. He also makes a living by raising pigs. He is asking for the loan to apply to his work in agriculture, for the purchase of fertilizers, urea, compost, liquid to combat pests, and a balanced diet for the pigs. He will buy the products in the city of Ventanas every two weeks. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs to prepare the land, to be able to plant, and to fatten the animals.

He faces challenges such as the budworm pest in his plants. His dream is to work and to improve himself. In his spare time he likes to talk to his parents and siblings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, compost, liquid to combat pests, and a balanced diet for pigs.

loans.name: Yanina Yanela

texts.es:
YANINA tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene una hija , vive con la hija en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

YANINA se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata la maleza.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hacen.

El sueño es superar las cosechas para poder incrementar el negocio y tener ingresos para solventar los estudios de la hija.En el tiempo libre le gusta enseñar a la hija jugar pelota y ser una persona que colabora con los programas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Yanina, 34, is single and has a daughter; she lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Bruniquilde” communal bank located in Recinto Calabi that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture.

Yanina works in agriculture growing corn and cacao.  She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure and weed killing liquid.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas every 15 days.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizer she so needs.

Her dream is to increase crop yields in order to increase business and have income to cover her daughter’s schooling.  In her free time she enjoys teaching her daughter to play ball and to be a person who collaborates with community programs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a training course in table and bar service

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años de edad, soltero.  Es un agricultor que cada año siembra 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Recuerda que desde que estaba muy pequeño su padre lo llevaba al campo  a que le ayudara  a realizar las labores de trabajo para cosechar la milpa. De ahí adquirió todo el conocimiento que ahora cada año pone en practica cuando se inician las siembra de maíz.

Él  es un muchacho trabajador, y deseoso de superación, y  que a pesar de su corta edad tiene muy  claro cuales son sus objetivos y metas en la vida. La profesión de ser agricultor la heredo de su padre, una persona que toda su vida a sido agricultor y que José dice es el mejor regalo que su padre pudo darle, la oportunidad de enseñarle un trabajo.

El prestamos que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla, para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

Con la producción que le genere la cosecha, espera obtener ingresos mayores a los costos de producción, con los cuales podrá tener una mejor calidad y dispondrá de  ingresos para el siguiente año, y a la vez en su casa no faltara el maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.


Planea cancelar el préstamo y seguir gozando de oportunidades de créditos en años siguientes. También desea construir su propia casa y no tener que andar alquilando donde vivir.
texts.en:
José’s a 20-year-old single young man.  He’s a farmer that plants 21,000 square meters of corn every year.  He remembers that when he was little his father would take him to the fields to help him with the chores related to growing corn.  That was where he learned everything necessary and now every year he puts it into practice when the corn planting season starts.

He is a hardworking young man who very much wants to improve.  Despite his young age, he’s very clear on his life goals and objectives.  He inherited the profession of agriculture form his father who has spent his entire life in agriculture and José says this is the best gift his father could have given him: the opportunity of teaching him to work.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy manure, pesticide, herbicide and seeds to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn.  He intends to earn income above costs from the harvest he generates that will allow him to have better quality and to have income for next year while at the same time his house will not lack corn to make tortillas.

He intends to repay the loan and continue to avail himself of credit opportunities in coming years.  He also wants to build his own house so that he won’t have to rent someplace to live.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Diente De Leon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIENTE DE LEON”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, tejido de chompa, venta de carne de llama, venta de cordero, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de cerveza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Diente de León” (Lion’s Tooth) communal bank will start its 9th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Martha.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: potato and dehydrated potato sales, sweater knitting, llama meat sales, lamb sales, neighborhood store, food sales and beer sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Martha.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling candy and she makes it known that she learned this business years ago on her own initiative.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy candy from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and subsequently well it in her sales space.  This form of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her family since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy candies.

loans.name: Loyda Raquel

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder seguir con sus cosechas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This client lives with her life partner and two children.  She has worked in agriculture for many years, mainly growing corn and beans.  With the money she earns she helps pay the household expenses.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and seeds etc., as well as improve the land where she will plant that is pictured in the photograph.  She works to continue harvesting as this is her only way to make money and provide her family what they need without limitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and seeds etc., as well as improve the land where she will plant

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su madre, su tía y su hijo de 5 años de edad, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her mother, her aunt and her five-year-old son. She is well-known in her area for her humility and her work. She refuses to be defeated and always comes out ahead despite difficulties. 

With effort and dedication she has a store in which she sells basic necessities: staple grain products, milk, eggs, rice among other items. She is very dedicated to her work and very attentive and that is why she has customers who look for her and they prefer her for her products. 

She has seen the necessity to stock her store a little more due to the increase of demand. She does not have the capital to do it and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy more products like staple grain products, instant products, treats, drinks, etc... 

She trusts in God that soon the assistance requested will be granted and she will no longer worry about the daily household costs.

loans.use: to buy staple grain products, instant products, treats, drinks, etc...

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
This is Clara, 64, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has a child who stays with her and together they manage their household while operating a variety store. Clara works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. In the Philippines, a variety store is a store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP of cooking oil, or an egg. Clara buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells them retail. She also sells mineral water. Clara's regular customers are neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Clara is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to continue her business and expand her product inventory. She dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to have a good life with the guidance of God.  Clara meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 44 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The youngest child is seven years old. 

She manages a tricycle transport service. She has been operating a tricycle for more than 10 years. Due to lack of capital to continue to serve her passengers, Emelita  requested  a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fuel, a tire and spare parts to avoid hassle and delay.

In the future, Emelita would like to expand her tricycle transport services so she can pay her weekly expenses and improve her family livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fuel, a tire and spare parts.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as focused and determined. To earn an income, he transports customers from one place to another, using his bicycle. 

Thomas will use the loan of KES 30,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit four members of his family. The family faces a challenge of lack of enough of a water storage facility. They will be able to store enough clean water to use.

This is Thomas' second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM). The previous loan was repaid successfully. He hopes that, in the future, he will grow economically and socially.

loans.use: to buy a water storage tank.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo quien trabaja de albañil, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, aguas y gaseosas  en su lugar de residencia tiene varios años de tener su negocio que le deja muy buenas ganancias ya que ese producto es muy vendible, con la ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor  ya que tiene mucha demanda y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This client, 30, lives in her own home with her son and husband who works as a bricklayer.  For several years she has been running a business from home selling soft drinks, mineral water and sodas for a very good profit.  With her earnings and help from her husband she is able to cover household expenses.


She is requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale because there is a huge demand and the increase in sales will earn more profit for her, allowing her to give her family everything it needs without limitation.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, mineral water and sodas wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de especias en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela pues su negocio lo tiene surtido con lo que los clientes necesitan, vive en casa propia con su hijo y su compañero de vida quien se dedica a trabajar de albañil, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas especias como: achiote, pimienta, canela, consomés, harinas, etc. por mayor para seguir su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client has made a living from selling spices in the market near her home for many years. She has a large clientele, as she has her business stocked with what her clients need. She lives in a house she owns with her son and her life partner, who makes a living by working as a mason. With the earnings from her sales, she manages to pay for some of her living expenses. The client is asking for a loan to buy more spices wholesale, such as annatto, pepper, cinnamon, broths, flours, etc., in order to continue her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy annatto, pepper, cinnamon, broths, flours, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Maria Lourdes. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her income helped her in the studies of her children as well as in their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Lourdes hopes to continuously grow her business and dreams that her children will be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor, tiene la edad  de 40 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra alimento y algunos materiales para poder hacer mejoras en la construcción del local donde pueda tener algunos cerdos para el engorde en mejores condiciones.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para el engorde. Además de obtener unos cerdos de buena calidad y que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja que otra institiciones.
texts.en:
Víctor is 40 years old and married. He lives with his children and wife, who are his biggest priority. With his loan he plans to buy food and material to make construction improvements to the premises where he can have some pigs for fattening. The idea is to take advantage of the space that he has and the good conditions for fattening. He also wants to obtain some good-quality pigs that can be fattened and of good quality in a short amount of time. 

With this purchase he will be able to develop this activity and have savings that will allow him to buy more and more animals and invest more in the project, and at the same time have more income for his family. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn’t received other loans in the past from state banks, and FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate that he would have received from other institutions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for fattening, and materials to improve the pen.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

Paulina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Paulina requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulina has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 29 years old and he lives in the small city of Vedi, which is in Ararat region. He lives with his parents, who are already retired, his wife and a small daughter. Tigran is the only breadwinner in his family and he works very hard as he strives for a better future for his family. Since being back from his military service, Tigran has tried to earn money by doing different work, but finally he became engaged in agriculture. He is cultivating a large variety of perfect vegetables (cucumbers, zucchini, tomatoes, beans, greens, eggplant, onions and radishes) tasty fruits (apples, apricots, peaches and plums) and also colorful berries (strawberries, dewberries, mulberries and currants). Tigran sells all the harvest at the Vedi wholesale food markets. He has one more occupation; he gathers hay and sells it to villagers living nearby, who use it as animal fodder. Tigarn is a very studious son and husband for his family and he is happy, since now he is able to provide his family with normal living conditions.

Tigran is asking for a loan, as he needs some support to organize his land cultivation and soil treatment. It will be a guarantee of a perfect harvest next season and a decent income as well.

loans.use: to organize his land cultivation and soil treatment

loans.name: Nestor Tomas

texts.es:
NESTOR tiene 50 años de edad de estado civil unión libre, vive con la pareja en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Nestor se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertiliznates urea, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo neceraio para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es seguir adelante con la ayuda de la cooperativa y de las ganas de trabajar para tener cómo sobrevivir y contar con un mundo mejor.

Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima y seguir con la agricultura.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Néstor, 50, is in a common law relationship and lives with his spouse in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Chonta” communal bank that’s located in Recinto La Chonta belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Néstor works in agriculture growing corn, soya and rice.  He requests the loan to buy fertilizer, urea and insecticide.  With the loan’s help he will be able to buy what’s needed for agriculture.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to continue forward with help from the cooperative and from his desire to work in order to survive and to have a better world.

The challenges he faces is bad weather and to continue with agriculture.  He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and insecticide.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He owns a retail shop that he has been running for the last nine years. 

This father of three knew of Milango through friends. Said now seeks a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to buy a sack of rice, wheat flour, and sugar as additional stock for his business. Said, 36, has an ambition of having a wholesale shop in five years time and he says the major challenges in this business are bad debts and the high cost of transport. The extra income as a result of this loan will help him pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Aged 40 years old, Mao is a rural villager from the Kam Rieng district. She is earning a living through farming rice. This is the only main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for seven years. The current business earns her about 6,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Mao is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Kunthea is a 22-year-old mother of one son who is too young for school. Rice farming and bean and corn growing have for two years been the income sources for her family to make a living. The current business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day, and she can manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Kunthea with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 30 years old shopkeeper.  She has run her shop for the past five years and earns a monthly income of ksh10,950, which she uses to provide for her family. 

She is married to Simon, who also contributes to the family’s daily income. 

Loice is applying for her first loan from KADET.  She will use the loan to buy more phone accessories.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she hopes to improve the living standard of her family. 

Loice dreams to start her own company and to build a good home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 55 years old. He is married to Naomi, a farmer, and they are blessed with four children. 

Gabriel has been operating in the transport sector for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to provide for his family.

Gabriel is applying for his third loan term with KADET, which he will use to purchases spare parts for his motorbike.

With the expected profit from the business, he will expand his business. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Eco Divino Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias empresarias de éxitos una de ellas es Oneyda mujer de 28 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad. Su negocio es la venta de cosmético de Avon y Arabela desde hace 2 años. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cremas para manos, pies y cuerpo, lociones, pinturas de labios, de uñas, maquillaje para la cara, etc. Belkys mujer de 21 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosmético  y  Lesbia tiene 24 años y su negocio es la venta de cosmético.
texts.en: This is a group of three enterprising, successful members.  One of them is Oneyda, a 28-year-old married woman with two children who are 10 and 2 years of age.  Her business for the last two years has been selling Avon and Arabela products.  She will use this loan to buy perfume, hand cream, foot and body cream, lotion, lipstick, nail polish, facial make-up, etc.  Belkys, 21, sells cosmetics and Lesbia, 24, sells cosmetics too.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en:
Jartu is a 39 year old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has four children, between 18 and 10.  They are currently attending school and live at home. She describes herself as hard working woman.
She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Jartu has been selling red oil, pepper, salt etc, for the past five years in the local market; she is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt etc for her business. She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes one day to own a house. 
 
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt etc for her business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk and tea ,eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming,  'poultry farming.' His biggest challenge is 'catering for expenses.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kapku.'

Benard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Farmer incentives.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and he replied, 'Savings.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Benard replied 'give them better living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benard owns a cow but does not own pigs, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, electricity, and a TV but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Baya

texts.en: Baya lives in Malindi, Kenya. The thirty-year-old schoolteacher runs a grocery store in his area. This has been his business for the last two years. He has employed someone to help him run the shop when he is at school. The items that he sells include flour, rice and tomatoes. He learned about Milango through a relative, at time when he wanted to fund his business. He now seeks a loan to buy cabbages, tomatoes and sugar. The major challenge for him is lack of capital. This husband and father of one believes that, if the business provides enough income, he will be able to improve his living standards and educate his family to the highest levels possible. He wants to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes and sugar for his store.

loans.name: Petrona Antonia

texts.es: La señora Petrona tiene 33 años de edad. Desde hace tres años trabaja dando clases a niños en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella vive con sus hijos. Una de sus hijas ya trabaja y le ayuda para pagar los gastos del hogar. Ella ha vivido toda su vida en una comunidad rural de Chinandega y nunca ha tenido energía eléctrica en su vivienda. Para iluminarse utiliza candelas y focos con baterías. Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un pequeño kit solar de dos luminarias que le permita tener iluminación por las noches y más seguridad para la familia.
texts.en: Petrona, 33, has worked teaching children in the community for the last three years.  She lives with her children.  One of her daughters works and helps her pay household expenses.  She’s lived her entire life in a rural community in Chinandega and has never had electricity in her house.  To have light she uses oil lamps and battery-powered light bulbs.  She’s asking for a loan to buy a small two-lamp solar energy system so that she can have light at night and more security for her family.

loans.use: to buy a small solar energy system to light her house.

loans.name: Fredis Obdulio

texts.es: Fredis, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Siguatepeque junto a su hermana y cuñado.  El cuenta con mucha experiencia en agricultura y lleva 5 años cultivando café en una área de terreno de su casa. Ha decidido por un segundo préstamo por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para poder mejorar su finca y sacar buena producción. Su meta es mantener bien su finca para que su futuro hijo tenga donde trabajar.
texts.en: Fredis, 21, lives in common law relationship with his spouse and lives with his sister and brother-in-law in a village belonging to Siguatepeque municipality.  He has much experience in agriculture and has been growing coffee on part of his house’s land for five years.  He’s decided on a second loan for 20,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy fertilizer to improve his farm and obtain a good crop yield.  His goal is to keep his farm well so that his future son will have a place to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 39-year-old business lady and a single mother of one child who is in college. She has been running her hotel for the past five years with a monthly income of 35,717 KES, which she uses to meet her family's needs and support her child. 

Winfred is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. Winfred will use this loan to open another hotel in order to add on her income. With the profit from the business she will support her child academically and improve her living standards. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have an excellent business and good health for her family.

loans.use: to open another hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit for her cows

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 41-year-old businessman; he is married to Agnes, a farmer. They are blessed with three children.

Antony has been selling timber as a primary business, and farming as a secondary business for the past ten years with a monthly income of ksh 10,000, which he uses to support his family. He also runs a motorcycle transport business to supplement his income.  Antony is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

Antony will use the loan to pay school fees for his children, buy fertilizer for his farm, and use the remaining amount to buy more timber for sale. 

He will improve his business with the expected profit from the business.

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children and improve on the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children, buy fertilizer for his farm, and use the remaining amount to buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casada, vive con su hijo y esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras condiciones que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Damaris is 45, married, lives with her son and husband who are her priority.  With her loan she hopes to buy fertilizer, fungicide and pay for labor to assist with her coffee plantation, as well as to buy some plants to re-plant when the rain season starts, with the goal to increase the density of the plants per section, as well as to take advantage of the soil's fertility and climate conditions that benefit coffee plantation.  With these improvements to the plantation she hopes to make more income and improve the life conditions of her family, as well as invest in the plantation and achieve some of her goals.  This is the first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She hadn't had loans with state banks before, but FIDECOSUR has provided more credit facilities and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicide and pay for labor to assist with her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Katy Yanet

texts.es:
La señora  Yaneth  tiene 26  años de edad,  vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, se dedica al negocio que de  venta de golosinas las cuales  vende de lunes a domingo por la mañana y tarde.
Doña Yaneth su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, además de vender golosinas también se dedica a la costura y  elabora buzos y camisetas colegiales, ella  mantiene contrato  con las diferentes  escuelas y colegios del municipio a las cuales les brinda su servicio.
Doña Yaneth está solicitando el préstamo para la compra  de  blusas, camisas, faldas, calzonetas, pantalones, etc. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea  salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Doña Yaneth su sueño es que su negocio en un futuro se mas grande.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio 2013
texts.en:
Yaneth, 26, lives in her house with her husband.  She sells snacks from Monday to Sunday mornings and afternoons.  Yaneth’s business is located at home and she’s been in this activity for six years.  In addition to selling snacks, she also works sewing and manufacturing school sweatshirts and t-shirts; she has contracts with various primary and secondary schools in the municipality she provides services to.

Yaneth is asking for this loan to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts, pants, etc.  Thanks to this loan’s support and with the profits she wants to get ahead and improve her income.  Her dream is that her business will be larger in future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2013

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, tomatoes, meat, green plantain, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Marlon Miguel

texts.es:
MARLON tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los abuelitos en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Marlon se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra fertiliznates, herbicidas, insceticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es sueño es comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta ser competitivo y leer mucho.
texts.en:
Marlon, 24, is single and has no children.  He lives with his grandparents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Chonta” communal bank located in Recinto La Chonta belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.
