Marlon works in agriculture growing corn, soy and rice.  He requests the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide.  With the loan’s help he will be able to buy what’s needed for agriculture.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to buy land.  He likes to be competitive and to read much in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Kanie

texts.en:
Kanie is 42 years old and lives at the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is unmarried, and she was unable to go to school. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past seven years, she has been running her restaurant, which sells rice and soup in the local market. She sells six days a week from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. She enjoys her business because of the flow of her customers. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancée. She uses a shared taxi most of the time to get her goods to her restaurant.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients, such as rice, Vita (juice drink), dry meat, fish, oil, onions, eggs, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients, such as rice, Vita, dry meat, fish, oil, onions, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Umu. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 11 years. 

In 2007, Umu established her shoes and textiles business. She began her business because she believes it will help her to be financially strong to assist her husband at home and to solve her personal problems. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are ladies. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Umu requires a loan in order to buy more stock to satisfy her customers. Her business has improved drastically. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene cinco hijos; pero ninguno vive con ella. La señora Rosa tiene siete años de vender pan, trabajo que aprendió por iniciativa propia, cuando trabajaba como empleada en una pupusería y elaboraban pan en algunas ocasiones.

Los insumos los adquiere en la ciudad más cercana a su casa, que se encuentra a unos 15 minutos de donde vive, y para ello tiene que caminar unos 200 metros para salir a la avenida donde aborda un moto taxi que le cobra $ 0.50 ctvs. Hasta el pueblo.

Actualmente, hay una señora que le presta $ 60 dólares para comprar los productos para la elaboración del pan, y después de la venta, es decir por la tarde tiene que pagarle el préstamo, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para trabajar con su propio capital, pagando una cuota pequeña cada mes

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar insumos para elaborar el pan, como levadura, harina, huevos, manteca, etc. y ya no tiene que tener esa preocupación de que por la tarde tiene que pagar lo que le prestaron, y podrá utilizar el dinero por más tiempo e invertirlo en el mismo negocio.


Los ideales a futuro es seguir trabajando y fortaleciendo el negocio cada vez más.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, married, and has five children, none of whom lives with her. Rosa has been selling bread for seven years, she learnt this job on her own initiative while she was the employee of a "pupusería" [a shop that makes and sells stuffed corn tortillas], where they sometimes made bread.

She buys the inputs in the nearest town, which is about 15 minutes from her home. In order to get there she needs to walk 200 meters until she reaches a big road where she takes a taxi that charges her 0.50 cents to get into town. At present a woman lends her 60 USD to buy the products she needs for making the bread, and after a day's sales, that is, in the afternoon, she has to pay back the loan. That is why she is applying for this loan so that she can work with her own capital, paying back a small amount every month. 

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is for buying inputs for making bread, such as leaven, flour, eggs, butter, etc. In this way she doesn't need to worry about paying back her loans every afternoon, and she will be able to use the money for a longer period of time and invest it in her business.

Her wish for the future is to continue working and strengthening her business every day.

loans.use: to buy inputs for making bread, such as leaven, flour, eggs, butter, etc.

loans.name: Themba

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Themba from Bulawayo. Themba is married and the couple have two children, The elder is attending a local school.  Themba runs a retail business selling footwear, clothes and electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for 15 years. He says the main challenges he faces in his line of business are high prices, competition and high import duty.

Themba has requested a loan of $500 to buy shoes and clothes. He also intends to buy electrical gadgets, which include DVD players, radios, speakers and TVs for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his business and enable him to do renovations to his house and cover other household expenses and school fees, since they do not have any other source of income besides the business. 

In the future Themba plans to open his own shop in town, selling various items under one roof.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing items, shoes and electrical gadgets for resale

loans.name: Nora Elsy

texts.es:
Nora tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace 17 años vive en la comunidad es muy conocida como una persona responsable y amigable además de ser ama de casa, ella junto con su esposo trabajan la agricultura desde hace mas de 10 años actividad que desempeñan con mucha experiencia, además de que ella los días domingos vende pupusas.   

El crédito lo solicita para comprar semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas y otros insumos agrícolas para sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz. Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia además de asegurar un mejor bienestar para su familia al generar granos para el consumo familiar. 

Espera que con los resultados de la cosecha, mejorar la estabilidad económica y alimenticia de la familia a parte de brindar una mayor unión familiar ya que de esta actividad se generan los ingresos de la familia, por lo cual aumentaría las utilidades en el hogar.   

Su deseo es, ver a sus hijos como profesionales, además de poder remodelar un poco su hogar ya que a futuro piensa ampliar la casa, además de poder ir ahorrando para abrir una cuenta para gastos personales para cuando ellos ya se encuentren en una edad más avanzada.
texts.en:
Nora is 32 years old, married and has two children. For the past 17 years, she has lived in the community, and she is well-known as a responsible and friendly person. In addition to being a housekeeper, she has worked with her husband in agriculture for the past 10 years. It is an activity that they carry out with much experience. Additionally, she sells pupusas on Sundays. 

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and other agricultural supplies to sow 10,500 square meters of corn. One of the primary necessities to meet is obtaining income for the family in addition to assuring a better wellbeing for her family upon generating grains for her family's use. 

She hopes, with the results of the harvest, to improve the economic stability and nutrition for her family, in addition to providing a better family union, since from this activity they generate the family income, with which she will increase the profits of the home. 

Her wish is to see her children as professionals, in addition to being able to remodel her home a bit, since in the future she is thinking about enlarging the house. Additionally, she hopes to be able to save in order to open an account for personal expenses for when they find themselves at an advanced age.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and other agricultural supplies to sow 10,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Marina Yaneth

texts.es:
Marina tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y ha procreado tres hijos. Ella vende panes con mortadela, pollo y salchichas, esta actividad la desempeña afuera de la escuela, además de eso muchas veces la contratan para hacer comidas ya sea de 15 años y otros eventos sociales.   

Ella tiene que comprar los materiales en la ciudad, para ello se desplaza a más de 45 kilómetros hasta llegar a la ciudad y a veces los productos también los compra en los carros repartidores que llegan a la comunidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un nuevo carrito movil, lo requiere ya que el que ella posee esta bastante viejo y maltratado y ya necesita que lo cambie, para así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia, además de poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, con el nuevo carrito para panes ella podrá desplazarse dentro de la comunidad y poder vender mas de sus deliciosos panes ya que con el actual no puede realizar esa actividad por lo viejo que esta. Desea tener una mejor estabilidad económica y alimenticia, dar una mejor calidad a sus clientes ya que son todos los alumnos que asisten a la escuela, además de poder mejorar las entradas al hogar.   

Entre sus planes esta comprar otro carrito para que así su hijo mayor pueda trabajar en la escuela que se encuentra en otra comunidad que esta a unos minutos de donde viven y de esa forma poder aumentar los ingresos a la familia, también desea ver a sus hijos poder terminar sus estudios básicos.
texts.en:
Marina is 36 years old, married and has three children.  She sells breads with mortadella, chicken and sausages.  She sells them outside of the school and she is often hired to cater various social events like Quinceañeras.  

She has to purchase her ingredients in the city, which is over 45 kilometers away, but sometimes she is able to purchase the products from the trucks that come to sell in her community.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase a new cart.  She needs it because the one she has now is very old and in poor shape, and must be replaced in order to provide better service to her clients.

One of the most important things she must do is earn an income for her family, in addition to satisfying the needs of her clients.  With the new bread cart, she will be able to travel within the community and be able to sell more of her delicious breads since her current cart does not allow her to do this given how old it is.  She wishes to be more financially and alimentary stable, give her clients the best quality, since they are all students, and be able to earn more money for her family.

In the future, she plans to purchase another cart so that her eldest son can work in the school in a neighboring community, and this way be able to increase the family's earnings.  She also hopes to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase a new cart

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos es un pequeño productor de 50 años de edad. Actualmente siembra granos básicos para autoconsumo y se dedica a la albañilería. Él tiene un hijo enfermo con capacidades diferentes. Ya tiene más de 28 años de vivir en una comunidad rural de Chinandega que no tiene acceso a energía eléctrica. Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar un pequeño kit solar para tener dos luminarias y poder recargar las baterías de su teléfono celular.
texts.en: Carlos is a 50-year-old small producer.  He currently grows basic grains for his own consumption and also works in construction.  He has an ill, special-needs son.  He’s been living in a rural community in Chinandega for more than 28 years that does not have access to electricity.  He’s asking for a loan to buy a small solar kit to have two lamps and to be able to recharge his cell phone’s batteries.

loans.use: to buy a small solar energy system for his house.

loans.name: Dorado Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DORADOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, licorería, pensión, venta de chinelas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su esposo y lleva en el negocio doce años, ya que es muy fructífero y le da opción de estar con sus hijos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de perfumes y cremas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The members of 'Dorado' community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The group has six members and is run by a board of directors which has Sonia as its treasurer.  The businesses that the group's members are engaged in are varied and include selling cosmetics, running a liquor store, running a small restaurant and selling flip flops.  

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these small businesswomen.  Sonia is a member of this group.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, through an invitation from a loan officer who came to visit her at home.  Sonia has a business selling cosmetics.  It was her husband who advised her to set up her business and she has been running it for twelve years.  It is very profitable and allows her to spend time with her children.

Sonia is taking out this loan to increase her merchandise.  She will buy perfumes and creams from wholesale suppliers and then sell them from her sales space.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sonia replied that she likes the group meetings.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams

loans.name: Lucrecia Genoveva

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Lucrecia se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo poder superarce para el bienestar de la familia. 

El sueño es tener dinero para seguir comprando tierras para sembrar. En el tiempo libre le gusta participar en lasa fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 27 years old.  She is single and does not have children.  She lives with her family in the city of Ventanas, De Los Rios province.  She is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank, which is located in the rural community of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas.  The members make their living doing agricultural work.

Lucrecia makes her living in agriculture, planting corn.  She is applying for a loan to buy inputs, fertilizers and manure.  She will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas every two weeks.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the inputs.

She faces challenges such as how to get ahead for the wellbeing of her family.  Her dream is to have money to be able to continue buying land for planting.  In her free time, she likes to participate in community parties.

loans.use: to buy inputs, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
Mburucuya esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de para conocer la situación de cada una en sus vidas y sus ingresos. Ellas están el 5to. Ciclo del programa de comités, están recibiendo capacitaciones para ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, esto quiere decir que si bien tiene buenos ingresos, debe seguir trabajando y mantenerse en ese nivel. Entre el trabajo que ella realiza es el de la costura, teniendo su propia clientela formada, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e hilos para poder seguir con su trabajo de costura, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mburucuya is doing the poverty-elimination survey to get to know the situation of each one of their lives and their incomes.  They are in their fifth term of the committee program, and they are receiving training in order to get ahead.

One of the members is Rosa, who in her last survey, showed a poverty level within level three.  That is, she has good income and should continue working and maintaining herself at this level.  Among the work that she does is that of tailoring, and she has her own clientele.  

The work of the assessors should also be highlighted, as they give permanent follow-up of training and verifications that in some way demand more of the women and at the same time motivate them to fight to overcome poverty.

Rosa is applying for this loan to buy fabric and thread to be able to continue with her tailoring work, which will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to use in her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des familles traditionnelles  au quartier SITOUGOULA de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec AFOU assise en deuxième position sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this Benkadi II group are married women with an average age of 44, on average four children each, and all living in traditional  families in the Sitougoula  district of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the other, prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Afou, who is  the second one seated in the photo, cultivates maize. She intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Afou expects to make a profit of 110,000 F CFA each season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her extended family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for seeds and plowing fees.

loans.name: Laguna Seca Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria es de estado civil casada tiene 27 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 2 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando, ella se dedica a vender especias para comidas, inició este negocio por la ayuda de su madre y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apóyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo y surtir sus ventas, espera en el futuro tener un local en el mercado donde pueda distribuir su venta. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tejeduría y al comercio. En la fotografia aparecen 12 señoras, pero, de ellas solo a 11 se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en: Maria is married and is 27 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She works selling spices for food. She started this business with the help of her mother and today she has seven years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who works in trade. She decided to organize a group to be able to apply for a loan, which she will use to increase her working capital and supply her sales. She hopes in the future to have a place in the market where she can distribute her wares. The rest of the group members work in weaving and trade. Twelve women appear in the photograph, but only eleven of them are receiving the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell spices for food.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 65 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y su nieto en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, abonos, fertilizantes,  etc. Doña Rosa tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa is 65 years old and lives at home with her husband and grandson. 

She grows corn and sorghum and has several years experience working in agriculture permitting her to obtain better crops. She sells the crops in the surrounding areas of the community. She has many customers that prefer her because of the quality, low prices and above all the good service.

She needs to invest so she is requesting a loan in order to buy seed, insecticide, herbicide, compost, fertilizer, etc. Rosa is known to have good payment references, and is very responsible, and is certain she can pay the debt in the period established and she is also confident that she can provide her household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, herbicide, compost, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson de 26 años está casado con Maribel y tiene una hija de 4 años con quien vive en una casa alquilada. Gerson se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años por está razón cuenta con dos terrenos de cultivo, donde produce café orgánico. “El café de mi zona es más solicitado, porque sus granos son más grandes”, menciona orgulloso. Su trabajo lo llena de satisfacciones, ya que consiguió compradores que se hicieron sus amigos. A la vez también produce plátanos entre los espacios libres que tiene en su terreno agrícola. Así aprovecha cada parcela al máximo. Ahora tiene pensado iniciar con la limpieza de sus cultivos ya que cada 3 meses la maleza impide el crecimiento de sus plantaciones.Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, ademas se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Gerson, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Gerson, 26, is married to Maribel and has a 4-year-old daughter with whom he lives in a rented house. Gerson has worked in agriculture for seven years. For this reason, he has two plots of land for growing, where he produces organic coffee. "The coffee from my area is more sought after, because the beans are bigger", he says proudly. His work fills him with satisfaction, because he found buyers who became his friends. At the same time, he also grows bananas in the free space on his farm land. That way, he takes maximum advantage of every parcel. Now he is planning to start weeding his crops because every three months the weeds impede the growth of his plants. This is his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial help that he is receiving to move forward. He also promises to make his payments punctually. Gerson will invest the 1,000 soles in purchasing organic fertilizer to nourish his planted fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to nourish the planted fields.

loans.name: Ouaga Est Bon Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADOUA SABINE est responsable du groupe OUAGA EST BON. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et des ensembles chaines  depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 04 pagnes Bazin, 04 pagnes simples et 01 douzaine d’ensemble chaine.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de construire une maison d’habitation. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Kadoua Sabine is the leader of the group called "Ouaga est bon". Married, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest 12. Two of them attend school and she has two other people to care for. 

Mme Kadou Sabine has been selling lengths of African print cloth and sets of necklaces for 10 years.  She buys her goods in the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women and men. 

She wants to buy four lengths of damask cloth, four  lengths of regular cloth, and one dozen sets of necklaces. She wants to save her profits to build a home to live in. Her ambition is to grow her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy four lengths of damask cloth, four lengths of plain cloth, and one dozen necklace sets for resale.

loans.name: Walter Emilio

texts.es: Walter es un joven de 29 años de edad. Él estudió hasta la secundaria. No pudo seguir estudiando por la situación económica familiar. Está casado y su esposa en estos momentos está embarazada. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a labores de albañilería, además siembra en una parcela granos básicos en época de invierno. Primero empezó como ayudante de albañil, poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora realiza trabajos por su cuenta y emplea a sus hermanos como ayudantes. El solicita un préstamo para comprar un sistema solar para así ofrecerle una mejor vida a su esposa e hijo por nacer.
texts.en:
Walter is a youth of 29 years of age. He studied up to high school. He could not continue studying because of the family financial situation.

He is married and his wife is pregnant right now. He has been working in masonry work for 8 years and also cultivates a plot of basic grains during winter. He started first as an assistant mason, learning little by little and now he works on his own and employs his brothers as helpers.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy a solar system in order to provide a better life for his wife and unborn child.

loans.use: to buy a small solar system for the use of his family

loans.name: Laloleisu

texts.en: Laloleisu is a 54-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Laloleisu needs a loan to buy a barbecue oven and more ingredients: a box of mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, soy sauce, tomato sauce, aluminum  foil, foam plates, onion and garlic. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and her family's standard of living. Laloleisu has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a barbecue oven, a box of mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des familles traditionnelles  au quartier SITOUGOULA de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec AWA debout en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la  droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village  et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this group called  Benkadi III are married women with an average age of 44, on average four children, and all living in traditional families in the district Sitougoula of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and both their preceding loans have been repaid correctly. 

Awa, standing second left to right in the photo, grows maize. She intends to use her loan to buy inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing for the cultivation of one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 100,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her extended family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria de 44 años de edad  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, talcos, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa alquilada con su hijo de 17 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, gloria desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and works selling all types of personal care products such as lotions, deodorants, creams, perfumes, and powders, among other items. Her business is located in her home and thanks to the earnings from her sales she can cover the household expenses. She lives in a rented house with her 17 year old son who is currently studying.

Gloria wants her business to grow and so she is asking for a loan in order to buy everything she needs such as perfume, nail polish, deodorant and also she wants to buy clothing as she has many customers to offer her products to at affordable prices. She will be able to make higher profits with the requested help and she will continue giving her son what he needs, lacking for nothing.

loans.use: to buy perfume, nail polish, deodorant, and also clothing to sell

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna, esta casada con Edmar, y tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa propia de material rústico. Giovanna, se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas heladas, las cuales son preparadas a base de frutas, en un puesto que queda a orillas del río. Ya tiene 15 años vendiendo en este lugar y en todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir buenos clientes. Diariamente vende un buen promedio 30 a 40 refrescos, pero comenta que en los meses de agosto, setiembre y octubre vende en mayores cantidades y sus ingresos se incrementan notoriamente. Ahora ella desea ambientar su negocio para poder generar más ganancias, pues tiene que aprovechar la temporada de mayor venta, además ya se arreglo la carretera a su comunidad y tiene mayor afluencia de turistas que también consumen los productos que ella comercializa todos los días. Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Giovanna, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de frutas, carnes y verduras para la preparación de sus comidas y refrescos.
texts.en:
Giovanna is married to Edmar, and they have a daughter with whom they live in their own house made from very basic materials.  Giovanna sells food and ice-cold drinks, which are prepared from fruit.  She sells from a stand on the banks of the river.  She has been selling in this place for 15 years.  In all of this time she has managed to acquire good customers.

Every day she sells a good average of 30 to 40 cold drinks.  However, she says that in the months of August, September, and October she sells in greater quantities, and her income increases significantly.  She now wishes to set up her business to be able to generate more earnings.  She needs to take advantage of the season when she sells more.  Also, the road to her community has been fixed, and she has a greater flow of tourists who also consume the products that she sells every day.

This is her second Kiva loan.  She is grateful for the financial support she is getting in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Giovanna will use the 2,000 to buy fruits, meat, and vegetables to prepare her food and cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy fruits, meat, and vegetables to prepare her food and cold drinks.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua earns a living through her food vending business in her place in Baclayon, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five grown-up children. Perpetua has been in her business for more than 10 years now. She sells home cooked foods.

Perpetua is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, and seasonings. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending, like meat, vegetables, and seasonings.

loans.name: Pompeya

texts.en:
Pompeya earns a living through her hog raising business in her place in Panglao, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Pompeya is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them. With this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita uses her loan for her business; that's why she is sure that it will reward her. True enough, for a long time now, her business has been a big help to her family, especially in the education of her children. Her husband also works to help them in their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy farming materials and other supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julita hopes that her business will last and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Cesar Felix

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

ESTA VRC SAN ANTONIO, SUS MIEMBROS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA TODOS VIVEN EN EL SECTOR DEL RECINTO AGUAS FRIAS. PRACTICAMENTE SE HAN CRIADO EN ESA ZONA, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIAS EN SU MAYORIA.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, herbicidas, abonos orgánico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Las compras y las ventas las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprar más terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver programas de cómo mejorar la agricultura.
texts.en:
Cesar is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

The members of the San Antonio community bank are all farmers who live in the rural settlement of Aguas Frias.  Nearly all of them grew up in this area.  Most of them make a living through farming and raising livestock.

Cesar grows corn, soy and rice.  He is requesting this loan to buy insecticides, herbicides and organic fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy everything he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas.

Cesar's dream is to buy more land.  The challenges that he faces in his business are pests and competition.  In his free time he enjoys watching farming programs.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 51 years old. He and his family live in Sevan city which is in Gegharkunik region. He is married and has a son who wants to attend Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, like his father. Vardan’s wife is unemployed and she, together with her husband, is engaged in farming as an occupation. 

Vardan has a specialty of engineering and for some time he has worked in his profession in different factories in Sevan district. Nevertheless, farming and agriculture brings in the major part of their income for his family. In his farm he is raising three cows, two bulls, three calves, ten sheep and twenty chickens.

 Vardan says that he loves nature very much, that is why he has planted a lot of trees in the back part of their land, despite the inconvenient and harsh climate,  and it has become a kind of small wild forest, where he from time to time  likes to be alone, think and relax in his leisure time. 

Vardan is asking for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to buy animal fodder for his farm's livestock for the winter months.

loans.use: To buy animal fodder for  the winter months  to provide a safe and well-fed winter for his animals

loans.name: Daniel Rosendo

texts.es:
DANIEL tiene 45 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene 2 hijos de  vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

DANIEL se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, urea y liquidos para la maleza.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

El sueño es que siempre cuente con buena salud para tener siempre trabajo para tener dienro para comprar lo necesario para los hijos. Es constumbre em la comunidad realizar bingos para sacar fondos para las fiestas.
texts.en:
Daniel is 45 and single. He has two children that with the family in the city of Ventanas, Los Rios province. He is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank, which is located in Cabali precinct, in the Ventanas canton where people work in agriculture. It's a custom in the community to play bingo games to raise money for parties.

Daniel works in agriculture, planting corn. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers, manure, urea, and weed killer. He will buy the products in the city of Ventanas. With help from the loan, he will be able to buy the supplies. His dream is that he always have his health so that he can always work, in order to buy what he needs for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, urea, and weed killer.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 53 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Alfredo desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 53, is committed to taking care of his family members and has always been known for offering them the best. He lives with his wife and children. He works hard and has always done so happily and enthusiastically. He is a farmer, who each year grows local crops such as corn and beans. 

Alfredo wants to increase sales and came to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and more. He is counting on the funding, since he has no other income source. This way, he will be able to easily support his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Keke

texts.en:
Keke is 40 years old and married with one child. She has a small garden where she grows tomatoes, cucumbers and green peppers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Keke needs a loan to buy a garden hose, solid set irrigation, a garden fork, hand fork, shovel, leaf rake, wheelbarrow, chain saw and sweet corn and Chinese cabbage seeds. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Keke will use the profits from her sales to extend her vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy a garden hose, solid set irrigation, a garden fork, hand fork, shovel, leaf rake, wheelbarrow, chain saw and sweet corn and Chinese cabbage seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  08 membres du groupe BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des familles traditionnelles  au quartier SITOUGOULA de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec BINTOU assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of this Benkadi IV group are married women with an average age of 44 and four children on average, and they all live in traditional families in the Sitougoula area of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

 They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and their other two loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Bintou, seated in the middle of the photo, grows maize. She intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare. The produce is sold right in the village and in the market, after the harvest, and she sells to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay the loan and also to help her extended family with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay the fees for plowing.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 49 años de edad es una persona amable, responsable y trabajador, vive con su hijo en casa propia, el se dedica desde hace 13 años hacer todo tipo de viajes en su pick up, tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por ser muy responsable a la hora de manejar, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, miguel esta solicitando un crédito para comprar repuestos para su vehículo y darle mantenimiento, ya que su vehículo es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Miguel, 49 years old, is a friendly, responsible and hardworking person. He lives with his son in his own home. He has been working for 13 years making all kinds of trips in his pick-up truck. He has a large number of customers, as he is sought after for being very responsible with his driving.

With the earnings from his work Miguel has been able to pay for some of his household expenses. Since his vehicle is his only source of work, Miguel is asking for a loan to buy parts for his car and to do repair work on it. In this way, he will be able to give his son all that he needs without any restrictions.

loans.use: to buy parts for his car and do repair work on it.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles  au quartier  FANGATONON  de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec  ABY FOUSSENY  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called Kotognogontala I are married women with an average age of 45 and six children, on average, all living in traditional families in the Fangatonon area of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the instituion and their other two loans were correctly reimbursed.  

Aby Fousseny, standing in the middle of the photo, cultivates rice. She intends to buy farm inputs, seeds and pay plowing fees to cultivate half a hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, and she sells to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loam and also to help the extended family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay the fees for plowing, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Eloisa

texts.es: Blanca de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene 4 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She owns a store where she sells basic household goods: beans, milk, eggs, bread, rice, sugar, candy, beverages, and more. She has run the business for four years, which has given her the experience to increase profits. The store is in her house, which is in a well-tracked area and is known to neighbors. She has many customers because her store is well stocked.

Blanca wants to grow her business and make another investment, but she lacks funding. She has applied for a loan to buy needed merchandise for her store. She is certain she can pay the loan and also give her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, rice, sugar, candy, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Otto Olmedo

texts.es:
OTTO tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene hijos, vive con la esposa y con el nieto de 14 años de edad en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

OTTO  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada semana. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura y al vender los productos podrá cancelar la deuda.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las pequeñas enfermedades de la familia. El sueño es trabajar un poco mas para tener dinero para cuando este enfermo. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar paseos con la familia.
texts.en:
Otto is 58 years old. He is married and has children. He lives with his wife and his 14-year-old grandson in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank located in the rural community of Calabi in Ventanas canton. The members work in farming.

Otto is a farmer and grows corn and beans. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, and manure.

He will purchase the products in the city of Ventanas every week. With the help of the loan, he will be able to invest in farming and, upon selling the produce, he will be able to pay back the debt.

He faces challenges such as his family's minor illnesses. His dream is to work a little more in order to have money for when he is sick. In his free time, he likes to take walks with the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, and manure

loans.name: Shazade

texts.en:
Shazade is very thankful to all of the Kiva lenders for her previous loan. With this support she has managed to improve her business by being able to purchase another sewing machine and additional materials for her work. Shazade mentioned that she has also improved the conditions for her family through her business by being able to provide adequate income for them. 

She is still very happy for having her successful business and she is planning to continue to work in the future. At the moment she is requesting a second loan for the same business so that she may add another sewing machine as she has a lot of customer demand since she has expanded her business. She hopes to increase, expand and generate even more income from her business and provide a more secure and stable life for her family. She really appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and materials for her work

loans.name: Elsie Maribel

texts.es:
ELSIE tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil unión lire tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventans Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

ELSIE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, balanceado y pollos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar las siembras y aumnetar la cría de pollos.
   
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima.
El sueño es tener un riego propio para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarce a los hijos.
texts.en:
Elsie is 35 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children. She lives with her partner and children in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province. She is a member of the Avanza community bank, whose members are farmers living in the area near the Agua Frías precinct. Most of them grew up in the area and make their livings by farming and raising poultry.

Elsie grows corn and rice for a living, and she also raises pigs and chickens. She requests a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, animal feed, and chickens. With the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her crops and increase the number of pigs that she raises. She makes her purchases and sells her products in Ventanas.

The challenges that she faces include competition and bad weather. Her dream is to have her own irrigation system for her crops. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, urea, animal feed, and chickens.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She lives with her husband who works as a farmer at Madaba-Jordan. Nawal has been working in trading children's clothes for 4 months. She started her project with her relatives and neighbors. Then she expanded her work zone. 

Nawal is seeking a loan to be able to expand her business by increasing the quantity of her merchandise and buying women's pajamas to trade, as she doesn’t have enough money for it now.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and women's pajamas for resale

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru:
Гулом с детства начал заниматься откормом скота. В молодости его родители сами ухаживали за скотом, со временем Гулом сам начал пасти скот и продолжил своё дело. Когда этот бизнес начал приносить ему доход он  всерьез занялся этим делом. Сейчас у него несколько  голов скота, но он хочет увеличить поголовье скота, и тем самым  развивать свой бизнес и увеличить капитал. 
У Гулома 4 прекрасных детей. Он мечтает чтобы его дети выросли здоровыми и получили хорошее образование, которое он по финансовым проблемам  не смог получить в юности. У него большие планы на будущее и делает все чтобы осуществить свои планы.     Гулом также учит своего старшего сына как правильно ухаживать за скатом и отдал ему  часть своего  скота .  Сыну тоже нравится ухаживать за скотом и он всячески помогает своему отцу. На данный момент у Гулом   планирует увеличить поголовье скота, так как сейчас выгодно покупать.
На полученный кредит Гулом хочет купить скот,и расширить свой бизнес.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за содействие и помощь.
texts.en:
Gulom learned about raising cattle from his parents when he was a child. Over time, he began to take care of them himself and operated his own business. When the business started to bring in income, he began to focus on it seriously. He now has a few head of cattle, but would like to increase their number to expand his business and earn more money.

Gulom has 4 wonderful children and he wants them to grow up health and well-educated. He himself could not go to school due to financial problems. He has big plans for the future and is doing everything he can to achieve his goals. Gulom is teaching his oldest son how to properly care for cattle and has given him some cattle of his own. His son likes to take care of the cattle and always helps his father. For the moment Gulom is planning to increase his herds because it is currently profitable to buy livestock. He wants to use the loan to buy cattle and expand his business. He thanks Arvand in advance for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Harvest Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50 year old Mavis from Mutare. She is married with two children and both are attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Mavis runs an agriculture business keeping broilers. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of a high mortality rate on some batches of chickens. 

Mavis has requested a loan of $800 to buys chicks and stockfeeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future Mavis plans to employ some youths within her area and expand the project to supply the whole of Manicaland province.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 50 años es una mujer trabajadora y vive en compañía de sus 2 pequeños hijos en la casa de material rústico que adquirió hace algunos años. Desde niña aprendió a cuidar de sus sembríos, pues posee terrenos en donde cultiva café y cítricos, gracias a estos productos obtiene muy buenos ingresos, pero como el café en el mercado es inestable, también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de frutas, para ello acondicionó un espacio en su casa donde todos los día recolecta cítricos maduros que lleva vende a los comerciantes mayoristas, aprovecha también en comercializar sus propias cosechas por lo que recibe un ingreso adicional. Ahora desea mejorar la cosecha de café, pues gracias a la variedad que sembró este año no tiene muchas perdida con la plaga. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Juana, invertirá S/.2800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Juana, 50, is a hard-working woman who lives with her 2 small children in a house she acquired several years ago made from rustic materials. Starting when she was a girl, she learned to take care of her crops, since she has land where she grows coffee and citrus fruits. She earns a very good income thanks to this produce, but since coffee is unstable in the market, she also buys and sells fruit. For this, she outfitted a space in her house where every day she collects mature citrus fruit that she sells to wholesale merchants. She also makes the most of selling her own harvests, from which she receives additional income. Now she wants to improve the coffee crop, since thanks to the variety she planted this year she did not have many losses with the insect infestation. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels thankful for the support that she receives to move ahead. She also promises to make her loan repayments in a punctual manner. Juana will use the 2000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a conservative woman so she asked her son Abdulrahman to take her place in the photo.
Faten lives in Wehdat-Jordan with her husband and her family which consists of four members. Faten has a son who is in his fourth year studying for a bachelor's degree in finance. But as Faten is having financial difficulties, she is seeking a loan to be able to pay for her son's study fees so that he will be able to work in his study field after his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's study fees

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is 18 years old and is in her first year studying for a bachelor's degree in monuments science. She lives in Marka-Jordan with her family which consists of four members. Ghadeer feels that she has many competitors in her study field so she is aiming to get the highest grades. She also is planning to expand her studies by getting her master's degree in the future. As she is currently facing financial problems, she is requesting a loan to cover her study fees.

loans.use: to cover her study fees

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 24 years old and lives in Zarqaa’ with her family which consists of four members. She has a brother who is in his fourth year studying for a bachelor's degree in accounting. As Aishas’ family is facing financial difficulties, she is requesting a loan for her brother to cover his study fees to be able to work in his study field in the future.

loans.use: to cover the study fees of her brother

loans.name: Qaisra's Group

texts.en: Qaisra is 31 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it, as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Qaisra, as a member of this three-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will enable him to resume his business. Qaisra is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairs to the rickshaw that her husband drives.

loans.name: Glenda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Glenda de 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 7 años, tiene mucha clientela porque vende su mercadería a buen precio, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hija, doña Glenda esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar mas ropa por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Glenda is 53 years old. She has been selling used clothing for 7 years. She has many customers because she sells her merchandise at a good price. Her business is located in her home. Her earnings cover the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her daughter. Glenda is asking for a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk as this is her only source of working to obtain higher earnings and give her daughter what she needs without lacking for anything.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 24 years old, and a single man from Deir el Balah. His father works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Ahmad is still a student in the university. He requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ahmad to buy a new laptop for his studies. He needs the laptop, because the electricity is not always available in his area. Electricity comes for only a few hours in the day. Having a laptop will help Ahmad at the times when there is no electricity, because it is rechargeable. This will help him to complete his work and achieve good marks. 

Ahmad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more local chickens from different villages.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina is a 55-year-old married woman and resident of the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her town. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 
Vivina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her inventory and attract more buyers to her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Hanife

texts.en:
Hanife is very thankful to all of the Kiva lenders for her previous loan. With that loan, she managed to improve her business by being able to purchase needed materials for her work. Hanife reported that her business has improved and also emphasized that she has been able to improve the conditions for her family at the same time. She is very happy for having her successful business and she is planning to continue to work in the future.

At the moment she is requesting a second loan for the same business in order to buy a sewing machine and other materials for her work. She hopes to increase, expand, and generate even more income from her business and provide a more secure and stable life for her family. She wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other materials for her work.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 5 children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 9. She engages in a hog raising business. She raises pigs. 

She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. On the other hand, her husband works as a carpenter. His income is not enough for the family's daily expenses, so Angelita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed, so the pigs can grow healthy and will be able to be sold on time. In the future, Angelita would like to improve her hog raising business to become more sustainable to provide her family with good living conditions as well as to save for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоире 42 года. Она трудолюбивая и замечательная женщина. Шоира как порядочная женщина имеет счастливую семью. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Муж Шоиры работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Она выращивает овощи и реализует на местном рынке. Шоира 5 лет назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством, так как доход ее мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Шоира постепенно развевает бизнес, и ее скот становится конкурентоспособным на местном рынке. Шоира получает от данного бизнеса хороший доход, так как ее муж выращивает сено для скота и ей дешево обходится откорм скота. Она хочет развевать бизнес дальше и увеличить доход. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить детей хорошим условием проживания и дать шанс для обучения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shoira is 42 years old.  She is a hardworking and remarkable woman. As she is a decent woman, she has a happy family. She is married and raising two children. Shoira's husband works on a farm. She grows vegetables and sells them at a local market. Five years ago, Shoira started her livestock business, as her husband's income was not enough to meet the family's needs. Shoira has steadily grown her business, and her livestock is becoming competitive on the local market. Shoira receives a good income from her business, as her husband grows hay for the cattle and it is cheap for her to feed them. She wants to grow her business further and increase her income. She plans to use the income to provide her children with good living conditions and give them a chance for an education. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5000 somons for the purchase of cattle.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has been not working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it, as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will enable him to resume his business. Razia is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to the rickshaw that her husband drives

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, age 21, is single and lives in the Telavi district with his parents and retired grandparents. His mother is an accountant at the technical store and his father serves locals as a taxi driver.

Zurab had to start working at a very young age and runs a car import business with his friend. They order second-hand cars from Europe, USA, and Japan and sell them in their district. These young fellows get special orders from clients and their profit is small. 

Zurab is very hard-working man, with a great desire to get ahead. He decided to diversify the business and obtain credit for starting a car wash. Zurab requested a loan to MFO Credo and the application was approved in the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses.

With the received loan, Zurab will purchase essential equipment: vacuum cleaner, hoses, power washers, etc. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase his monthly income. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and give Zurab the opportunity to make savings for house renovation. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a car wash and purchase essential equipment.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 47-year-old married woman from Kutaisi district. She lives with her 48-year-old husband Gia and their two sons, who go to school. Nana is unemployed at the moment. Gia has a workshop where he produces different kinds of footwear by orders. As this is the only income for their family and it isn’t stable, Nana decided to start her own business with a loan.

Her loan request was rejected several times by financial institutions, as she wasn’t able to satisfy their requirements because of lack of business experience and financial stability. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, a so called Start-Up program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

With the loan of $2700, Nana will open a grocery store. She will purchase a stock of groceries and household goods. As the grocery shop is opened, Nana will become financially independent. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. With the increased income she will pay for her sons' educations and will expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Berta Lilian

texts.es: Berta de 39 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en el granero que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Berta solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Berta, 39 years old, is very friendly and hardworking. She lives with her husband and her two children. 

She works very hard on her own farm where she grows corn and beans. Her products are of very high quality. When her harvest is ready it’s deposited in the storage place in the barn shown in the photograph and then later it is sold to different markets that are near her home.

Berta is asking for a loan from Integral in order to have the necessary money and to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizer, compost, seed, and more things that she needs for planting.

She is very eager for her sales to increase and to be able to make higher profits and give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizer, compost, seed, and more things

loans.name: Prayer Warriors Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39 year old Winnet from Mutare. She is widowed, with four children, three of whom attend school.

Winnet runs an agriculture business rearing broilers. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge is that of high mortality rate during winter periods. Winnet has requested a loan of $600 to buy more feed for the chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan, will allow her to send her children to better schools. In the future, Winnet plans to supply chicken to shops and hotels around town.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the poultry project

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Frank, who is in his early 30s, is single. He has been running a shop selling DVDs - movies and audios.  He is also a music player (DJ) at private parties and ceremonies.  Frank has been engaged in these activities for five years. He works from 8am to 7pm daily, but sometimes up to midnight hours, in case he has a music play job.  He is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan, Frank restocked more DVDs-movies which resold to more customers. He has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the return from the business to cover household expenses, and saved part of it, to reinvest in the business. He will use this loan to buy a business computer and restock more DVDs for resale. He dreams of being able to expand his business some day. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mt Ulunguru" which has12 members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business computer and restock more DVDs to resell.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles  au quartier  FANGATONON  de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec  MARIAM debout en première position sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group called KOTOGNOGONTALA II are married women with an average age of 45 and on average six children, all living in traditional families in the Fangatonon area of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the other two loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Mariam, first person standing in the photo, cultivates rice. She intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs, seeds and pay the fees for plowing to maintain one half hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
 
She expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA each season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also help the extended family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay fees for plowing, etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de un familiar con la abuela, el tiene un negocio de venta de celulares, accesorios, audífonos, baterías, cargadores, etc. desde hace varios años, con lo que gana de su trabajo ayuda a la abuela en los gastos del hogar  y  también cubre sus gastos personales, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor ya que tiene buena demanda por sus buenos productos, la amabilidad y buen trabajo que realiza, ya que no tiene suficiente capital para poder realizarlo y asi seguir con su negocio para ayudar en los gastos de la casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The loan applicant lives in the home of a family member with his grandmother. 

He has a business selling cell phones, accessories, headsets, batteries, chargers, etc, and has been doing this for several years.

With his earnings he can help his grandmother with the household expenses and he can also cover his personal expenses.
