They are in their fourth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution  to meet the needs of their customers. Previous loans have been fully repaid.

Kadia, who is standing at the extreme right of the photo, retails sets of clothes and other clothing in the Farafina Lolo group of women. Her reputation with this activity makes her a highly sought-after vendor.

She intends to use the loan to buy three dozen full sets of clothing (pants and shirt and / or dress and skirt) for children. She sells as an itinerant vendor and with her family, for cash and credit to her clientele consisting of men and women. She resupplies in Bamako and Sikasso.

She expects average monthly profits of 35,000 FCFA,  part of which is used to repay the loan and the interest, and the other part put into savings.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana habita con su esposo y sus dos  hijos en casa propia, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar de residencia. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de  varios años, cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Ana lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ella  sueña con dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio,  por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el, por lo que cada día trabaja duramente para por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and their two children in their own house. She is an enterprising and fighting woman. Some years ago, she decided to set up a small business in her home. The business consists of a small store which, with a lot of effort and dedication, she has succeeded in maintaining over several years. 

She has many customers, as the most important things for Ana are her customers. She always serves them with a smile and a lot of kindness. This is because she has gained the trust of many in her area, and also because she always has what her customers are looking for. 

She dreams of giving her children a better quality of life and knows that her only source of income is her small business. Therefore, she cannot neglect it, and she works hard every day to keep it active. 

It is for this reason that she is motivated to request this loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in her little store and stock it with all kinds of products, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, paper, detergent, and more products that are appealing for her clients. She says that in this way, she will succeed in fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; María es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia,  quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. María tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old and lives with her common law partner and their two children. She owns a tortilla making business which is very well-known in her neighbourhood. She has many customers because she sells the best tortillas - piping hot and with very quick service in addition to truly reasonable prices. Maria is a very dedicated woman who wants to succeed. She has a winning attitude and because of this she always stays ahead of the competition. She is willing to accept risk in order to promote the growth of her business and so she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL in order to enable her to buy corn in bulk. Maria hopes that in this way she will be able to bring economic security to her home and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El señor  Agustín de  60 años de edad  es  casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación,   se dedica a la venta  de leche desde hace 30 años, es conocido en la zona como una persona luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo a logrado salir adelante.
Don Agustín actualmente cuenta con ganado de donde obtiene la leche y  la vende a personas que tienen  descremadora y procesan dicho producto, su  actividad es de lunes a domingo.
Don Agustín está solicitando el préstamo  para la compra  de  concentrado para alimentar a sus vacas. Y con las ganancias  y el apoyo de este préstamo  espera poder salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos, para que su calidad de vida mejore un poco..
Don Agustín su sueño es  que con las ganancias que obtenga pueda comprar más ganado.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Junio 2013
texts.en:
Agustín is 60 years old; he is married and lives with his wife in their home. He has worked selling milk for 30 years. He is known in the area as a fighting person who, with a lot of effort, has succeeded in getting ahead. 

Agustín currently has cattle, from which he obtains milk and sells it to people who have a milk skimmer and process the milk. He works from Monday to Sunday. 

Agustín is requesting this loan for the purchase of feed for his cows. With his earnings and the support from this loan, he hopes to be able to get ahead and continue increasing his income, so that his quality of life might improve a little. 

Agustín’s dream is that, with the earnings he will get, he will be able to purchase more cattle. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for his business.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
This is Cecilio. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the needed spare parts for his tricycle. The loan also helped in the education of his youngest child and in their everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts, maintain his tricycle unit and to also buy some equipment for the repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Cecilio hopes to be successful in his business and have more tricycle units. He dreams of giving his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 22-year-old married woman from Alyamon village near Jenin city. She is a mother with three children: one son and two daughters. Hiba's husband works in a grocery store as a worker, and also, the family has olive trees. They sell olive oil in Jenin city and outside Jenin. 

Hiba took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Hiba's husband to buy a private car to help him in his work like to transfer goods for the grocery store and to transfer the olive oil to the city so he can sell it there. This will help Hiba and her family to reduce the costs of transportation, and so their income will be increased.

Hiba appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a private car to transfer goods for the grocery store and transport olive oil.

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po, aged 41, is married and lives in a densely populated area of Prey Chor district with his family. For a living, he is a diligent father who strives to be involved in many types of business ventures. He helps his wife manage their own farm of rice and also raises pigs, distills Khmer white wine and provides milling services to local farmers. He has been doing these business activities for more than 10 years.

He is applying for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to help him to use as rolling capital for the purchase of rice for milling. After removing the covering of the rice seed, he can sell his rice to local traders for a profitable price, which he will use for home expenses, allowances for his children, and for paying back to the loan to HKL. He hopes to have a good profit with the loan support from kind lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice for milling and selling at a profitable price.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in his new home.

Hadeel is a 25-year-old married woman from Attel village near Tulkarm city. She is a mother with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are under 10 years old. Hadeel's husband works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low wage. This wage is barely cover the family needs. 

Hadeel took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Hadeel to improve the family's living conditions by paying the costs of painting the house. This will help Hadeel and her family in part with the urgent expenses they have.

loans.use: to pay the costs of painting the house.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is 48 years old. She is married with six children. With the loan she would like to buy more foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the new loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs, such as bananas and sorghum for sale. The profits will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as bananas and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm equipment.

Zenaida has been farming rice for 27 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and selling coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 47-year-old married woman living with her spouse and nine children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns sufficient income for his family. Recently, he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop. He tried to take a loan from banks and other organizations, but he does not have any property against security. Nasreen requested a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because the BRAC Pakistan provided the facility to empower poor people without asking about assets.

Nasreen wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf for getting beef to sell.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is an electrician by profession. This is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is insufficient to meet daily expenses. Presently he needs to purchase wires, switches, sockets etc. to sell. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of purchasing the things for his business. Therefore Kaneez has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. This will help him to continue his business. 

With the profit expected from this loan he wants to purchase daily household food items. Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wires, switches, sockets etc to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married with a pair of twins, aged 2. Her husband works as a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more soaps, rice and maize flour for sale. The profits expected from the business will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Ahab

texts.en:
Ahab is a 49-year-old married father of five children. He has been working in selling iron and copper scraps since 2002.  He is well known in this domain. He buys and sells these scraps to metal factories at very impressive and encouraging prices. At the beginning he faced obstacles to expand his business, but through his previous Al Majmoua acquired loans, Ahab was capable of buying a small truck to transport his merchandise easily.
Ahab has an additional source of income. Since his family is dear to him, he has to be ready for any sudden request, which is why he has been working in a small cafe where he has been responsible for the hookah section for five years.

Today, Ahab is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy iron scraps at a very good price and sell it at a very good price too, in addition to paying his children's school fees. He hopes to expand his scrap business and to buy a wider truck, where he can collect a larger mass of scraps in it.

loans.use: to buy and sell iron scraps at a very good price, in addition to paying his children's school fees.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is 22 years old. She sells ladies clothes and has been in the business for the past four years. She would like to get the loan to buy more bitenge for sale. Bitenge are ladies' clothes. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a tailor by profession. He has excellent tailoring skills, and his customers appreciate his work. They simply love his stitched dresses. Presently, he needs to purchase a tailoring machine to stitch up more dresses in less time. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the machine. Therefore, Yasmeen, as a member of two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. This will help him to grow his business and to increase his net income and savings. Yasmeen is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine to stitch up more dresses.

loans.name: Mwachidofu

texts.en:
Mwachidofu is married and the father of seven children, five of whom still attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a goat-meat selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to purchase five goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for resale.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 45-year-old married man from a small village called Vita near Tulkarem City. He is a father with eleven children -- eight sons and three daughters. He works as a construction worker, and this is the only source of income to the family. He is a hard worker, but his job is seasonal and not stable. 

Naser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of building a stone fence for his home. This will make his home safer, especially for his kids. He appears in the photo in front of his home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of building a stone fence for his home.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 42-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives in a small house with his wife and seven sons. Imad works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This income barely covers the family needs, so de decided to have another job. Imad has also worked as a taxi driver since one year ago. It is a profitable job, but not easy. Imad works extra hours at night to get a decent income so he and his family can live in good conditions. 

Imad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new engine for his taxi because the old one is fully depreciated. This will increase the taxi capacity and will reduce using fuel.
 
Imad is pictured in front of his taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 21 years old, from the small village of Khashuri district. He lives with his 31-year-old brother and mother. Sadly, for a lack of economic resources and because they had to start working at a very young age, George and his brother were unable to study a professional career. They both work at a local petrol station and get a small monthly income.Their mother works as a kitchen maid at a local restaurant. As the family expenses exceed the total income, Tamaz decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poors and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $300 to open a bakery. George thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. 

After the bakery is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  With support of the start-up program, George will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 37 years old. She has three daughters, two of them are studying in the 6th and the 4th grade. The one other is little. Her husband works in the village and grows rice. He earns about 15,000,000 VND per month. 

Ha breeds pigs and sells beverages at a stall to earn a living. She has done this job for ten years. She earns about 10,000,000 VND per month and her family’s total earnings are about 25,000,000 VND per month. 

Ha’s challenges in life and work are calamity and natural diseases. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and have a successful future. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She can expand her farm to gain earnings and save profits for her children’s education. 

Ha is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In her last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND. In this loan cycle, Ha would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more animals to breed to expand her family’s farm.

loans.use: to buy more animals to breed to expand her family’s farm.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 39 years old, and has three children, two daughters and one son. The oldest children are studying in the 10th and the 8th grade. The youngest daughter is little. Her husband is a building worker. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

Hoa grows rice and breeds animals. She has done this job for 15 years and earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,500,000 VND per month. However, her work is unstable and the output price of products is low. This is one of her challenges in life. 

Her dream is that her children can have a successful future. This loan is one of the steps that will help her to reach this dream. 

Hoa is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. Hoa has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In her last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for her breeding farm and buy more animal breeds.

loans.use: to buy food for her breeding farm and buy more animal breeds.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Bintu is 45 years old and is married with seven children aged between 4 and 23 years old. She runs a palm oil business in the Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to create a permanent source of living for her children. 

She has been in this business for 12 years now, and sells palm oil at a particular market place. She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business, and transportation is a problem.  

Bintu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 43-year-old married man. He lives in Al- Zababdeh near Jenin city with his wife and two sons. Imad and his wife works as teachers in the local school. They get a good income but not enough for the family. 

Imad also owns a sheep farm in his village. He would like to buy more sheep and add water fountains. These improvements need a lot of capital. So Imad has taken a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep and improve his farm. This will increase his income and his family will live in a better conditions.

Imad appears in the Kiva profile picture while he was at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and improve his farm

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 25 years old. She has been selling used shoes for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mahdya

texts.en:
Mahdya is a 26-year-old married woman from Jenin city. She lives with her husband in a humble house. Mahdya's husband works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. 

Mahdya opened a clothing store a few years ago. She sells Islamic Abayah and other kinds of clothes for women. She imports her goods from Turkey because it is of good quality. 

She has taken a loan from FATEN to help her to pay the rental costs for her store. This will help Mahdya to cover her urgent expenses.
 
Mahdya appears in the photo while she was working in her clothing store.

loans.use: to pay the rental costs for her clothing store.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 42 years old and is married with five children aged between 6 and 25 years old. She runs a local food in the Waterloo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Three of her children are currently going to school.

She has been in business for 25 years now and sells food made with rice and sugar. She says that the main problem for her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more rice and sugar to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her childrens' school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, and is married with two children who are in school. He is in a transport business which he has operated for the past three years.

Peter has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy a motorbike. With his anticipated profits, he hopes to support his wife's grocery business.

In the future, Peter hopes to have a stable income so as to support his family as well as educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a motobike.

loans.name: Ndanda

texts.en:
Ndanda is a single man. He rents a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rental bills.

For the past five years, Ndanda has operated a charcoal selling business. He sells from his home to his neighbours and passersby. His major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase six bags of charcoal to re-sell. 

Ndanda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase six bags of charcoal to re-sell.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing recycling services for many years to different manufacturing companies. He buys plastic bottles that contained Pepsi, Coke, Mirinda and other beverages that would otherwise be trash. After proper crushing and converting into small dana, he sells them back to the manufacturing companies for recycling. Through this business he makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood.

Rubina has four children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family. She is in her fourth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan of PKR 42,000 for her husband so that he can buy more bottles in different sizes to increase his sales.
 
Rubina is very thankful to Kiva's field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron & plastic bottles for recycling.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu, she is in her late thirties and is from the Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children aged between 2 and 10 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2005, Isatu established her wood business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Isatu plans to change her business to a local food business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is Margaret. Her previous loan helped her a lot in her business as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. She used her income to help her siblings and her parents. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margaret dreams to have a grocery store someday and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma was born in 1985. She is single and her father is deceased. She lives in Zarqaa’-Jordan with her three siblings. 

Basma has been working in rustic embroidery for eight years. She is planning to create new drawings and eye-catching colors in the future. She is requesting a youth loan to buy strings and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy strings and fabrics for her embroidery.

loans.name: Zahriya

texts.en:
Zahriya was born in 1950. She is widowed and lives in Zarqaa-Jordan with her four children. 

Zahriya has been working in trading clothes and abayas for eight years. She started her project with her friends and neighbors. She is planning to open her own store in the future. She is seeking a loan so she can buy new clothes and abayas to be able to expand her project.

loans.use: to start her own clothing store.

loans.name: Eyman

texts.en:
Eyman is a 25-year-old single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is very hardworking. With much effort and dedication, she has managed to save money. She is a hairdresser who has owned a beauty salon for two years. She said that without sacrifice, there is no reward and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can. She would like to expand her business. She applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetic materials and beauty salon accessories. With this loan, she will be able to expand her beauty salon to increase her profit. 

In the future, she hopes to open big beauty salon.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon to increase her profit.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 26 years old. He is married to Eunice and they have one child. 

Martin has been in the milk-selling business for the past five years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to get a premises and buy more milk to sell. With his anticipated profits, he plans to expand his business so he can improve his living standards. Martin currently earns an average income of KES 15,000 per month.

In the future, Martin hopes to expand his business and have a stable income.

loans.use: to pay for business premises and buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela was born in 1972. She is a widow and has six children. All of her children are under the age of 13. 

Nabeela started working in trading clothes and abayas five years ago, which has been profitable for her. One of her future plans is to open her own store. She is seeking a loan to increase her merchandise, in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 50 years old, and is married to James. They have three children. Gladys is a farmer from Olkalau, and she also has a hotel business. 

She has applied for her third loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for labour. She has repaid her previous loans on time. 

With her anticipated profits, she hopes to buy stock for her hotel and repay the loan.

In the future, Gladys hopes to see her dairy farm and hotel grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 32 year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. Since 2011, he has owned a butchery where he serves delicious and fresh meat. He has a part-time employee who is helping him with his work. 

Rabih is the main income source for his family. And today, he would like to request a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas S.a.l to purchase a new refrigerator. He states that this refrigerator will help him keep meat in a healthy condition, and therefore he will maintain his loyal customers who always visit him to buy his appetizing and hygienic meat. 

In the future, Rabih plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for his butchery shop.

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en: Rosane paid off her loan early this time as she was eager to replenish her stock. She is now increasing her stock by 30%! She is still selling TiPowa on a rent-to-own basis and demand is growing!

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a clean energy retail business.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam was born in 1980. She lives in Zarqa, Jordan, with five children. Ahlam has been working in trading clothes and shoes for six years. She also has been buying dresses and embroidering them. Ahlam is planning to open her own store in the future. Now she is requesting a loan to buy Russian clothes and accessories to sell them to her neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: to buy Russian clothes and accessories to re-sell

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Rashida from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children aged between 2 and 8 years old.  In 2010, Rashida established her cookery business. She began her business because she did not go school.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Rashida requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and palm oil to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Rashida plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and palm oil to expand her cookery business

loans.name: Concepcion De Joyabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos es madre soltera, de edad 39 años, no le dieron la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 7 hojos y ni uno de ellos esta estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol, inició este negocio sembrando en cada invierno del año y a la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica también a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante para sus cultivos, espera en el futuro optar a mas tierra y sembrar mas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de cerdos y siembra de maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Santos is a 39-year-old single mother. She was not given the opportunity to go to school. She has seven children and none of them are studying. She makes a living from agriculture by planting corn and beans. She began this business by planting every winter and she now has 25 years of experience. She has help from her husband, who also makes a living from agriculture.

She organizes a group and she is requesting a loan, which will enable her to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to get more land in the future and plant more crops. The other members of the group make a living from pig breeding and planting corn and beans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn and bean crops

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is 22 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his family which consists of 10 members. He is studying a Bachelor of Special Education and working at the same time as a reporter at a health centre. Mousa is planning to expand his study to Masters level in order to work in his study field and get a better income. Now he is requesting a loan to cover his study fees.

loans.use: to cover his study fees

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites. She previously accessed a loan of 19,000 PHP that she used to buy additional stock of merchandise such as pants and children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional stock of merchandise like pants and children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites hopes to have her own family and dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise such as pants and children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz Benigna

texts.es: Luz es una mujer emprendedora de 48 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de 13 años. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace 7 años en su comunidad. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de fletes de leña, carbón y la compra por quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, cajas de jabón, pampers, chiverías,carne de res, carne de pollo, sal, pan simple, pan dulce, huevos, sopa maggi, medicamentos populares, productos lacteos  etc.
texts.en: Luz is an enterprising woman of 48 years of age. She is a single mother to a 13-year-old son. Her business is a grocery store located in her community, which she has had for seven years. She will invest the loan she has requested in purchasing firewood and coal, in addition to 100-pound containers of rice, beans, sugar, boxes of soap, diapers, snacks, beef, chicken, salt, bread, sweet bread, eggs, Maggi soup, popular medications, dairy products, etc.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and coal, in addition to staples, such as rice, beans, sugar, boxes of soap, diapers, snacks, beef, chicken, salt, sweet bread, bread, eggs, Maggi soup, popular medications, and dairy products

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam was born in 1965. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Tamam has been buying and selling blankets for four years. She also runs a nursery for children in her house. She plans to expand her trade in blankets to earn a better income. To do that, she is requesting a loan to buy more blankets.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Noora

texts.en: Noora was born in 1983. She is married and has 3 children. She has been selling underwear for men and women for 4 years; this has been a profitable work for her. Noora is asking for a youth loan to buy new merchandise to trade so that she can get a better income and cover her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Monsieur   Bassirou  est  un  homme   marié   qui  habite   au   Sénégal.  Il  évolue   dans  le   secteur   de  l’éducation  depuis   4  ans et exerce la profession de   professeur  d’arabe.  Avec  son  salaire  il  parvient  à  gérer  les   charges  de    loyer,  de  transport, de  nourriture  et   les  factures. Parallèlement  il pratique l’activité de commerce et s’adonne des fois  à l’achat et la vente de coquille s.  Avec   ce  crédit  il  souhaite accroitre ses revenus pour pouvoir  épargner de l’argent et améliorer les  conditions   alimentaires  de  la  famille. Son projet dans le futur est d’acquérir un terrain.
texts.en:
Bassirou is a married man who lives in Senegal. He has been an Arabic teacher for four years. With his salary he is able to manage the costs for rent, transportation, food, and bills. 

In addition to being a teacher, Bassirou also works buying and selling scallops. With this loan, he would like to increase his earnings in order to save money and improve his family's diet and nutrition.

His future goal is to acquire a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy scallops to resell

loans.name: Iasinta

texts.en:
Iasinta, 62, is married with seven children. She has a small taro (a root vegetable) and banana plantation. To earn extra income, she also has an iced cake business. 

Iasinta needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, barbed wire and chemicals as well as cordial, foam cups, a sack of sugar and Chinese lollies (sweets). She will use her profits to help with her family’s daily needs.

Iasinta joined South Pacific Business Development in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, barbed wire and chemicals as well as cordial, foam cups, a sack of sugar and Chinese lollies (sweets) for her farming and bakery businesses

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina, 45, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Zarina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in the household needs. Zarina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles.

loans.name: Jose Miramor

texts.es: Don José tiene 52 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus dos hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. El tiene 10 años de tener su propia finca de café, además cultiva maíz y frijoles. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos de donde cubre sus gastos. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y  lo va invertir en su finca para darle un buen mantenimiento al café y fertilizar sus otros cultivos. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo como agricultor.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old and single.  He lives with his two brothers in a village in the municipality of Protección, Santa Bárbara.  He has had his own coffee farm for 10 years, and also plants corn and beans.  This work is his source of income to cover his expenses.  

He is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to invest in his farm by providing good maintenance to his coffee and fertilizing his other crops.  His goal is to continue growing as a farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to maintain his farm and crops.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un joven de 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive únicamente con su mamá; ha pasado por situaciones difíciles debido a la inestabilidad económica en su hogar. Actualmente se dedica a estudiar, pero por falta de experiencia laboral y de conocimientos le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades de empleo, pero su visión y sus ganas de salir adelante lo motivaron para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en el pago de un curso de capacitación en Servicio de Mesa y Bar, con lo cual podrá adquirir conocimientos y abrirse puertas en el campo laboral. 
Santiago sueña con salir adelante montando su propio negocio, que sea próspero y rentable, para así poder obtener ingresos, que le permitan brindar apoyo económico y una mejor calidad de vida a su mamá.
texts.en:
Santiago is 20 years old, single, and lives with his mother.  He has experienced difficult situations at home due to financial instability.  Currently he is a student, but he lacks work experience and knowledge, so it has been difficult to find job opportunities.  

His vision and desire to improve himself has motivated him to request this loan, which he will invest in payment for a training course in Table and Bar Service.  This will provide him with knowledge and open doors in the labor market.

Santiago dreams of opening his own business, which would be prosperous and profitable so that he can earn income, which will allow him to provide financial support and a better quality of life for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for a training course in Table and Bar Service.

loans.name: Buena Vista Ii Chinique Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta de estado civil casada, cuenta con 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, inició este negocio sembrando con su familia unas plantitas en época de invierno y hasta la fecha lleva 25 dichosos años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura también.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para poder abonar sus cosechas, en el futuro espera cosechar suficiente para el consumo y para la venta. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y frijol como a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Marta is married by common law.  She is 36 years old and never had the opportunity to study.  She has 4 children and 2 of them are in school.  She works growing corn and beans, a business which she began by planting a few plants at a time with her family in the wintertime.  She currently has 25 years of experience and the support of her husband, who is also involved in agriculture.

She has organized a group and asked for a loan which she plans to use for buying chemical fertilizer to fertilize her crops.  In the future, she hopes to harvest enough to eat and to sell.  The other members of the group work also in planting beans and corn and raise livestock as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Rositas De Calasaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE CALASAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de tucumanas y salteñas, tienda de barrio, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wilma es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su madre al observar que contaba con vacas lecheras, que es la materia primordial para la elaboración del producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza elaborara los productos para su comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The group “ROSITAS DE CALASAYA” will begin their first loan cycle at Pro Mujer as a part of the center of Copacabana.  The group is made up of ten members and is directed by the Board of Trustees, of which Wilma is the President.  The businesses which the members of the community banking group are growing and succeeding at are varied and include: milk sales, sales of meat and potato pastries (Tucumanas y Salteñas), a neaighborhood grocery, and cheese sales.

The loan they will receive will benefit the small businesses which Wilma is a member of, and it has been 5 years since she joined Pro Mujer, becoming a part of this bank through the invitation of a friend who works at the institution.  Currently, she has a business in the production and sale of cheese.  SHe became aware of this business and learned to do the work with the help of her mother, watching her with her milch cows, which is the root material which forms her own business product.

The loan that she will now receive is to grow her merchandise (by buying more cattle stock) which she will acquire from the neighboring communities and then the raising and creation of her products for market.  This type of work allows her to generate funds for maintenance of her household, since she lives in a common law union and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she is pleased by the workshops on health and loan credit.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 20 años de edad, ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Maribel  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. Maribel es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maribel is 54 years old and lives in a house she owns with her 20 year old son.  She has a store which sells staple products such as bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, vegetables, and others.  She is a responsible and friendly person who has many customers in spite of her store not having much variety of products.  

Maribel is requesting this loan so that she can have the necessary money to purchase a larger quantity of products.  Her main goal is to be able to stock her store and earn more profits.  

Maribel is a very responsible female head of her family who wants to be able to provide the best of everything for her son.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Yapuchiri 7 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YAPUCHIRI 7” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos, servicios de alimentación y producción de vestimenta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gregoria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frazadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su familia, que viaja a la frontera del país a traer estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de frazadas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor de la frontera de Bolivia y Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajar en grupo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Yapuchiri 7 community bank is starting their 10th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board where Gregoria is the president.  The businesses that the members have are varied and include product sales, food services, and clothing production.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Gregoria.  She joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling blankets.  She says she started this business on advice from her family.  She travels to the border of the country to get these products.

She is requesting this loan to increase her merchandise and purchase more blankets.  She will acquire them from wholesale vendors on the border of Bolivia and Peru and later sell them at her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes working with the group and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase blankets.

loans.name: Fotemogoban I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali :. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le poids sucré  avec    MAMINATA assise en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Fotemogoban I group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. 

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan was paid back correctly.

Maminata, seated second from the left in the photo, grows sweet peas. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to men and women customers. 

Maminata hopes to earn 75,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband in the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Rosa Ester

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella tiene un chalet ubicado en las afueras de un supermercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia donde vende golosinas y refrescos,  tiene mucha clientela pues está ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, rosa esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old and lives in a home she owns with her family.  She has a stand located outside a supermarket close to her home where she sells snacks and drinks.  She has many customers since she is located in a high traffic area.  With the income she earns, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses.  

Rosa is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices so that she can earn more profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, a 33-year-old married mother of three, has been working in her husband's convenience store for two years now. He husband opened the store in 2008, but due to his family's increasing needs he opened a small car-washing service to earn more income. Since that time, Fatima has been developing the convenience store to meet customer needs and requests.

Fatima's work is going on just fine, but she is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to help her husband in his business through the purchase of special car oils and a special oil suction machine to develop his business. This will be Fatima's second loan from Al Majmoua; her previous loan was invested in developing her store, and it reflected positively on her family's socioeconomic situation. She hopes to keep on responding to the needs of her family and customers and continue to develop her and her husband's businesses.

loans.use: to help her husband in his business through the purchase of a special oil suction machine and special car oils to develop his business

loans.name: Fotemogoban Ii Group

texts.fr:

La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré  avec   DIALIA en position assise au milieu.

Dialia, seated in the middle [of the photo], grows sweet peas. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare of land.

Dialia hopes to earn 75,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

The members of the Fotemogoban III group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. 

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan has been paid back correctly.

Fatoumata, standing second from the left [in the photo], grows sweet peas. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to men and women customers. 

Fatoumata hopes to earn 90,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en: Arwa was born in 1969. She is married and has six children. She has been selling foodstuffs at home for five years. She started her business selling supplies to children, and this project was profitable to her. She could buy a refrigerator and a coffee maker from her income. Now she is planning to expand her home mini market. As her mini market is out of merchandise, and she doesn’t have enough money to buy more, she is seeking a loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her mini market

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu is 26 years old, married, and has three children,. She runs a bakery in the Waterloo Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. She's been in this business for three years. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because she has been able to take of her family out of the profits. Ramatu applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more cooking oil, flour and sugar for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera was born in 1949. She is widowed, and all of her children are married. She lives alone in Madaba, Jordan. Sameera started work trading clothes, blankets and wedding dresses a year ago. She started her work with a group, with a small amount of money. Then she improved her work and started working alone. She has faced an obstacle to doing her work, which is transportation. Sameera is planning to expand her work in the future. Now she is applying for a loan to buy new merchandise, such as clothes and wedding dresses.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise, such as clothes and wedding dresses.

loans.name: Teresa Dombina

texts.es: Teresa de 49 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia, La señora teresa es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en: Teresa is 49 years old. She lives with her life's companion in her own home. Teresa is a hardworking, responsible and enterprising woman who for several years has worked in the production and sale of dairy products in the area where she lived. She has a very good clientele and she has been able to win her customers' trust. She offers quality products at a good price. She has decided to invest in caring for her cattle, since her business depends on them. That is why she has asked for a loan to be able to buy vitamins and concentrate for the cattle. With this, she hopes to obtain favorable results and continue to offer financial help to her home, which needs it so much.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrate for cattle.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Gulzar is a 57-year-old woman. She has been running a business selling clothing for many years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Gulzar applied for a loan of PKR UGX 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Meet 30-year-old Zainab from the Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 12. Her children are currently attending school. In 2007, Zainab established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that she lacks enough capital to run her business. Zainab wants a loan in order to buy a greater variety of clothing to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future; Zainab plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en: Lubna is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She has been doing business as a tailor for five years to help her husband. She has accepted the fact that, if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy more spools of thread and packets of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand from her customers without fail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Lubna hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and packets of buttons and laces in various colors for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en: Loimata is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for a year. Loimata needs a loan to buy barbed wire, fertilizer, vegetable seeds and garden hose. She joined SBPD in 2013. Loimata will use the profits from her sales to save for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, fertilizer, vegetable seeds and garden hose for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali :. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré  avec MARIAM debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  des ’intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called FOTEMOGOBAN IV are married women with an average age of 46 and on average, five children, all living in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, their preceding loan having been correctly reimbursed. 

Mariam, the second person standing from right to left in the photo, cultivates sugar peas. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA each season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 44 años de edad,  está casado y vive en casa de sus padres junto su esposa, sus hijos, y todo la familia.  Guillermo se dedica al transporte para eso cuenta con un mototaxi que se compró hace 03 años que viene realizando este oficio, llevando sus clientes a sus destinos de manera segura. Le gusta su actividad pues le brinda los ingresos económicos y el poder de manejar su propio tiempo y sentirse independiente. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte en la ciudad y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y crecer. Esto será el primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.  Con el monto  de 600 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 44 years old.  He is married and lives in the house of his parents with his wife, his children and the whole family.  Guillermo works in transportation and for that he has a moto-taxi that he bought himself three years ago that has been doing this job, taking his customers to their destinations safely.  He likes his work as it provides economic income and the power to manage his own time and feel independent.  He considers his business quite profitable because of the demand for transportation in the city and the good earnings that it gives him.  Therefore he has plans to expand his business and grow.  

This will be his first loan with Kiva so he hopes for the collaboration in order to continue with his objectives.  With the amount of 600 nuevos soles (PEN) he will invest in the purchase of spare parts for the maintenance of his moto-taxi.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and also to do maintenance on his moto-taxi.
